Some of these cities will provide you with the valuable wood you need to construct your magnificent Pyramid Complex in your new capital at Itjtawy. You should acknowledge their obedience by helping them in their times of need. Other cities, however, chafe under your rule. On, Khmun and Waset will rise up against you. Be prepared to strike them down if they rebel. Itjtawy should offer just enough of the finer things in life to keep people in the city. Your ratings goals are: Culture Rating of 30, Prosperity Rating of 40, Kingdom Rating of 40 and population of 5000. Be forewarned: if you do not accomplish these goals quickly, trouble could arise.
Missions/#CM06_mission: Egypt's dominance has spread across the Mediterranean, and you have decided to personally oversee the establishment of Enkomi in Cyprus. Enkomi will be one of the most beautiful cities in the Egyptian empire, replete with all the luxuries of Egyptain life. Conditions in the city must be good enough for ten Palatial Estates to be established. You must also mark the territory as Egyptian by building three obelisks. While you are busy in Enkomi, people on the Egyptian mainland grumble about your absence. Some claim you have forgotten your priorities. As Egypt impatiently awaits your return, usurpers eye the throne of the land with increasing intensity. Complete your tasks in Enkomi as quickly as possible so that you can return to Egypt and reaffirm your power. If you linger too long in Enkomi, all will be lost...
Missions/#CM07_mission: Great Pharaoh, your armies have conquered Kerma! Build a new city upon its ruins and defend it from marauding Kushites.The city site is very rich in resources and the terrain lends itself to defense. Only ever increasingly powerful Kushite invasions will disturb your city building plans.
Missions/#CM09_mission: Pepy II has ruled Egypt for some 90 years and, like the old Pharaoh, the government is showing signs of crumbling. As the leader of Henen-nesw, you have designs on Egypt's throne. To prove your worthiness, quickly build an exemplary city at Henen-nesw, teeming with 10,000 people. Provide enough of the sweeter things in life to earn a Culture Rating of 60 and a Prosperity Rating of 70 and to allow for the development of one Palatial Estate. The rest of Egypt looks upon you with wary eyes, distrustful of your intentions. Lull them into a sense of security by responding to their every whim, earning a Kingdom Rating of 100. Crown your fine achievement by building three monuments, a Mausoleum, a Large Stepped Pyramid and a Small Stepped Pyramid. Quickly complete your goals, and prove to the country that you would make a much finer ruler than those upstarts at Waset. As you build your city at Henen-nesw, you find yourself being threatened by your enemies, the Libyans. To add to your difficulties, bloodthirsty Bedouin soldiers lurk to the west of the city. The rest of Egypt is concerned about your Pharaonic ambitions and will carefully watch your actions. If you appear to be a threat to them, they will push to cut you off before you have an opportunity to grow.
Missions/#CM12_mission: You have everything you need to build the city of your dreams. You can afford to be generous with your resources, and as a result the rest of the world just can't shower you with enough gifts.
Missions/#CM13_mission: What is this desolate wasteland whither you have been sent by Pharaoh? Legends of Libyan riches are false and the supple coast of which Pharaoh's messengers spoke is nothing but a rocky wasteland. Pharaoh has tasked you with establishing a prosperous port here, yet only with the help of the gods will you be able to succeed. Where is the copper that made the strong Libyan weapons? Where are the fertile pastures spoken of as legendary? Who are the mysterious Sea People threatening to invade your shores? Show respect for the gods in times of need: build temple complexes to celebrate their power and they will help you through your times of trouble.
Missions/#CM14_mission: Egypt is a shining star amidst a land of savages. Any enlightened individual can clearly see that Egypt's achievements outshine all others and this is surely due to divine providence from the gods themselves. But there are those who prefer to live as animals rather than rise to their divinely assigned status. Thieves and villains plunder the tombs of your forefathers despite their most carefully laid out designs. Pharaoh does not wish his afterlife to be disturbed and has wisely chosen to construct his monument away from the eyes of the greedy jackals that would violate a consecrated tomb to profit their own contemptible existence. Pharaoh wishes his burial place to be somewhat more modest, and therefore less attractive to rogues, than his forebears. He has chosen you to build a mausoleum deep inside the carved caverns of the living rock itself. Workers have completed the hollowing out of a suitably sized chamber deep within a network of caves. You are now to finish the project by building Pharaoh's eternal resting place. You will be responsible for getting all needed supplies into the cavern and constructing the mausoleum, no small task. Pharaoh will also make good use of your operation to ensure a steady supply of copper to the kingdom.
Missions/#CM17_mission: Pharaoh is confused. He has mistaken your oasis town of Farafra for a granite-producing city and is requesting granite from you for the construction of obelisks at Iken. In order to avoid humiliating Pharaoh by pointing out his mistake, you must fulfill his request in a timely fashion. Of course, this is all in addition to the fact that you are constructing a mausoleum and a pyramid for him... Use your knowledge of trade and manufacturing to satisfy the needs of Pharaoh.
Missions/#CM25_mission: In the Egyptian outpost at Shaat you will face a fierce band of Hyksos who have found refuge in the Kushite city of Kerma. Pharaoh has chosen you as the most capable of defeating these rogue invaders - a task which must be completed before Shaat can hope to prosper. Your best hope of defeating the fearsome Hyksos is to make good use of the mighty chariot. After rebuffing years of attacks from the Hyksos, respond to Kerma's request for troops to stamp out the Hyksos' threat once and for all. The people who are brave enough to live in Shaat should be rewarded for enduring attack after attack. Conditions in the city should be posh enough to result in one Palatial Estate. You also need to build a large obelisk to remind citizens of Egypt's glory and to declare Egypt's dominance to the Hyksos. By the way, you might notice that the game will say that four Palatial Estates are needed to win. Because the game counts each tile of a Palatial Estate separately, this really means that only one Palatial Estate is needed.
Missions/#CM26_mission: Pharaoh has ordered you to build a settlement at Farafra Oasis. In this arid land you must build a prosperous city, build large Mastaba tombs, and supply Pharaoh with all that he asks for (Pharaoh especially likes the local pottery, bricks, and wood). The only problem is that the Oasis is rather small. Your citizens will need the water that the oasis supplies, wild game inhabit the grassy areas, fertile meadows lie nearby, and valuable trees surround the oasis. It will take careful city planning to use the oasis to its fullest.
Missions/#CM30_mission: Pharaoh's ability to rule is waning in his advanced years. Governmental infrastructure has become increasingly disorganized. Cities that once depended on leadership and trade from the capital are striking out on their own to acquire what they need. Some of these cities will call upon your city for assistance. Helping your neighbors will open new trade routes. But beware, as Pharaoh's power wanes, some communities will become bolder and greedier, and they may try to extort you. However, one city will prove to be an ally, and will provide you with gifts of valuable copper in exchange for military support. If you can protect your sister city, you can form an alliance to quash these treasonous cities and bring peace to the region. By then, trade with a new city will be available. This new route will provide you with the granite you need to build an obelisk in the ailing Pharaoh's honor.
Menu/#Remove_Save_Desc: Are you absolutely certain you want to delete this save forever?
Menu/#Remove_Family_Desc: This deletes the selected dynasty and all of its saved games. Are you sure you want to do that?
Menu/#Population_hover: {0} workers out of {1} inhabitants. Unemployment at {2}%
Menu/#Funds_hover: Make sure you don't go into debt
Menu/#Funds_hover_EmergencyFundUsed: You already used your emergency fund, don't go into debt again.
Menu/#Funds_hover_Negative: Find a way to make some deben before you reach a debt of 5000
Menu/#Funds_hover_Over5000: You won't be able to build anything unless you debt gets lower than 5000 debens
Menu/Options/#Worforce_0_hover: Buildings send recruiters looking for the workforce in inhabited houses
Menu/Options/#Worforce_1_hover: Every building has access to the workforce as long as it's connected to a road
Menu/Options/#Aging_0_hover: Citizens grow old, and only the ones between 20 and 49 years old work
Menu/Options/#Aging_1_hover: {0}% of the population is always available for work.
Menu/Options/#Predators_0_hover: Predators roam the map and will kill citizens that pass by too closely
Menu/Options/#Predators_1_hover: There are no dangers on the map
Menu/Options/#WalkerRanger_0_hover: All walkers have the same basic range
Menu/Options/#WalkerRanger_1_hover: Every type of walker has its own range, some can cover more tiles than others
Menu/Options/#StorageDefault_0_hover: Granaries & Storage Yards accept all goods by default
Menu/Options/#StorageDefault_1_hover: Granaries & Storage Yards refuse all goods by default
Menu/Options/#BazaarDefault_0_hover: Bazaar accept and distribute all goods by default
Menu/Options/#BazaarDefault_1_hover: Bazaar don't distribute any goods by default
Menu/Options/#DockDefault_0_hover: Docks trade all resources by default
Menu/Options/#DockDefault_1_hover: Docks don't trade any resource by default
Menu/Options/#Waterlift_0_hover: Waterlifts automatically get access to the workforce even when not connected to a road
Menu/Options/#Waterlift_1_hover: Waterlifts need a connection to a road in order to get access to the workforce
Menu/Options/#Tower_0_hover: Towers get access to the workforce event when not connected to a road
Menu/Options/#Tower_1_hover: Towers need a connection to a road in order to get access to the workforce
Menu/Options/#Subcategory_0_hover: Clicking on a building category on the rightbar opens every subcategory directly
Menu/Options/#Subcategory_1_hover: You have to individually click on every subcategory in order to access the buildings inside
Menu/Options/#HoverDelay_hover: Duration of time you can hover over a building before the info is displayed
Menu/Options/#OverseerPause_0_hover: Opening any Overseer pauses the game
Menu/Options/#OverseerPause_1_hover: Your city keeps running while you consult the Overseers
Menu/Options/#EventsPause_0_hover: Scripted Events prompts pause the game
Menu/Options/#EventsPause_1_hover: You city keeps running while a scripted event prompt is displayed
Menu/Options/#Gardens_0_hover: You can click & drag to build gardens. They are selected randomly and regroup themselves automatically by stack of 2x2 or 3x3 when possible
Menu/Options/#Gardens_1_hover: You can place Gardens the same way you can place Statues and change their look by pressing the rotation key
Menu/Options/#StorageYardDefault_0_hover: Storage Yards accept all goods by default
Menu/Options/#StorageYardDefault_1_hover: Storage Yards refuse all goods by default
Menu/Options/#GranaryDefault_0_hover: Granaries accept all goods by default
Menu/Options/#GranaryDefault_1_hover: Granaries refuse all goods by default
Menu/Options/#UncappedZoom_hover: You can zoom out as much as you want. Can have a severe effect on performances, use at your own risks
Menu/Options/Hotkey/#CallToAction: Press the key you wish to bind to this command
Menu/Options/Hotkey/#Alert_Content:
This key is already used for the following command: {0}.
If you decided to assign it anyway it will unbind from: {0}.

Menu/#Hover_NilometerPoor: The next flood is likely to be poor
Menu/#Hover_NilometerMediocre: The next flood is likely to be mediocre
Menu/#Hover_NilometerGood: The next flood should be good
Menu/#Hover_NilometerExcellent: The next flood should be excellent
Menu/#Hover_NilometerPerfect: The next flood should be perfect
Menu/#DesirabilityOverlay_Hover_0: This is one of the least desirable places in town
Menu/#DesirabilityOverlay_Hover_1: No one would prefer to live here, but there are worse places
Menu/#DesirabilityOverlay_Hover_2: People have no strong feelings about this area's desirability
Menu/#DesirabilityOverlay_Hover_3: This area is better than some, although not highly attractive
Menu/#DesirabilityOverlay_Hover_4: Most people would find this a pleasant place to live
Menu/#DesirabilityOverlay_Hover_5: This is among the most fashionable addresses in your city
Menu/GameMode/#CustomDesc: Challenge yourself on standalone missions or build the city of your dreams in sandbox mode.
Menu/#Battle_Victory:
You have defeated the invaders! {[city_name]} is safe for now...
Rebuild your army as soon as possible!
Menu/#Battle_Defeat_Normal:
Invaders pillaged your treasury, {[debens]} debens <sprite name="Deben"> were stolen and some of your buildings were destroyed.
They've now retreated, but that will not be the case if your city finds itself in debt or if your Kingdom Rating falls too low.
Menu/#Battle_Defeat_Debt: With no debens <sprite name="Deben"> in your treasury, invaders decided to stay and oust your from power. They'll find someone that will not leave an empty vault behind them.
Menu/#Battle_Defeat_Kingdom: As your reputation in Egypt is so low, invaders oust you from power without any trouble, and will rule {[city_name]} in your place!
Menu/#Battle_Defeat_DebtANDKingdom: You've lost the battle, but you've also lost the respect of your population and your fellow Egyptians. Now that there is no army to defend you, your own people oust you from power!
Menu/Options/#Difficulty_Title_0_hover: A more relaxed way to play
Menu/Options/#Difficulty_Title_1_hover: The standard way of experiencing Pharaoh: A New Era
Menu/Options/#Difficulty_Title_2_hover: For those who seek more of a challenge
Menu/Options/#Difficulty_Title_Hover: Set the difficulty level to how you feel most comfortable with.
Menu/#Campaign_Save_None: There is no campaign save for this family

Monuments/#Mausoleum_Phase_1_Desc: The foundation has been placed and workers are clearing the site
Monuments/#Mausoleum_Phase_2_Desc: Masons are constructing the lower part of the mausoleum
Monuments/#Mausoleum_Phase_3_Desc: Stonemasons are constructing the upper part of the mausoleum
Monuments/#Mausoleum_Waiting1: A lone stonemason is waiting for sandstone <sprite name="Sandstone">
Monuments/#Mausoleum_Waiting: Stonemasons are waiting for sandstone <sprite name="Sandstone">
Monuments/#Mausoleum_BlocksNeeded: {0}<sprite name="Sandstone">blocks of sandstone are needed to finish construction of the mausoleum
Monuments/#Mausoleum_Started: Now that we've got enough sandstone, we can start on this monument. My workers are clearing the site now.
Monuments/#Mausoleum_Working: Masons are working hard to complete this mausoleum. Everything's on schedule, and I don't expect any problems.
Monuments/#Mausoleum_Carpenter needed: This mausoleum requires a carpenter's services.
Monuments/#Obelisk_Phase_1: Phase One: Obtain granite to place rough structure
Monuments/#Obelisk_Phase_2: Phase Two: Carpenters use wood to build scaffolding
Monuments/#Obelisk_Phase_3: Phase Three: Stonemasons carve final shape, working from top to bottom
Monuments/#Obelisk_Phase_2_Desc: Finally we have all the granite we need. Once my carpenters finish building the scaffolding, stonemasons can begin carving the obelisk.
Monuments/#Obelisk_Phase_3_Desc: My stonemasons are hard at work carving the mighty obelisk.
Monuments/#SunTemple_Phase_1_Desc: The rough obelisk has been placed and workers are clearing the site
Monuments/#SunTemple_Phase_2_Desc: Carpenters are placing scaffolds around the obelisk
Monuments/#SunTemple_Phase_3_Desc: Stone masons are carving the final shape of the obelisk
Monuments/#SunTemple_Phase_4_Desc: The vestibule, wall, plaza, and fore temple are being constructed
Monuments/#SunTemple_Waiting1: A lone stone mason is waiting for sandstone.
Monuments/#SunTemple_Waiting: stone masons are waiting for sandstone.
Monuments/#SunTemple_BlocksNeeded: {0} blocks of sandstone are needed to finish construction of the Sun Temple.
Monuments/#SunTemple_Remainder: The remainder of the sun temple will require an additional {0} blocks of sandstone ({1} loads).
Monuments/#SunTemple_WorkingPyramid: Workers are now finishing the outside of the pyramid.
Monuments/#SunTemple_WorkingClearSite: Now that we have enough sandstone, we can begin work on the sun temple. My workers are just clearing the site now.
Monuments/#SunTemple_WorkingCarpenters: Once my carpenters finish building the scaffolding, masons can begin carving the central obelisk for the sun temple.
Monuments/#SunTemple_WorkingCarving: My masons are carving the central obelisk now. When they're done, we'll need more sandstone to finish the rest of the sun temple.
Monuments/#SunTemple_WorkingWalls: As soon as we finish the vestibule, wall and fore-temple, this monument will be complete.
Monuments/#Mastaba_ClearSite: First, workers need to clear the mastaba site down to bedrock. More peasants from Work Camps could speed the leveling process.
Monuments/#Mastaba_Phase_1: Workers are just clearing the construction site now. After that, we'll need plenty of bricks for the mastaba.
Monuments/#Mastaba_Phase_2: Everything seems to be going just fine. This mastaba will be done in no time.
Monuments/#Sphinx_Phase_1: Masons are creating the rough shape of the sphinx.
Monuments/#Sphinx_Phase_2: Masons are doing some fine carving on the sphinx.
Monuments/#Sphinx_Phase_3: Workers are finishing and painting the sphinx.
Monuments/#Pyramid_ClearSite_1: First, workers need to clear the pyramid site down to bedrock. More peasants from Work Camps could speed the leveling process.
Monuments/#Pyramid_ClearSite_2: Workers are now cutting grooves into the bedrock to hold water. More peasants from Work Camps would hasten this job.
Monuments/#Pyramid_ClearSite_3: Now we're filling the grooves in the bedrock with water. More peasants from Work Camps could make this go more quickly.
Monuments/#Pyramid_ClearSite_4: Workers are marking the water level, then draining water from the grooves.
Monuments/#Pyramid_ClearSite_5: We're very carefully cutting the bedrock down to the water-level marks. No one will ever see this work, but it ensures that the monument will endure forever.
Monuments/#Pyramid_ClearSite_6: The water-level grooves are being filled with rubble. It has to be tightly compacted so that the monument won't settle over time.
Monuments/#Pyramid_ClearSite_7: Site preparation is finished! We've leveled the land, and now we're ready to build the tomb.
Monuments/#Pyramid_ClearSite_8: The base has been leveled and a roof is being placed on the tomb. Now, there's a resting place fit for eternity.
Monuments/#Pyramid_Complete: At last, the pyramid is complete!

Monuments/#NotEnoughWorkCamps: All of the city's peasants are needed on the floodplain farms, leaving them only three months out of the year to work on this project. Build more Work Camps near the monument site to speed things up.
Monuments/#NoAccess: Workers can't get to the monument's staging area. See what's blocking the planks that mark it.
Monuments/#Foreman_NoWorkCamps: Do you think the gods are going to build this monument? Build some Work Camps so that I can get some peasant labor, and quickly!
Monuments/#Foreman_NoStonemasons: There are no stonemasons available to work on this monument. If you want progress, build a Stonemasons' Guild at once!
Monuments/#Foreman_NoBricklayers: I suppose the bricks for this project will magically assemble themselves. That must be your plan, since you haven't built a Bricklayers' Guild.
Monuments/#Foreman_NoCarpenters: With no Carpenters' Guild in the city to build ramps or scaffolds, I hope that you're planning on a very short monument!
Monuments/#Foreman_NotEnoughWorkCamps: No peasants have reported for duty. I'd find out why, if I were you. Maybe your Work Camps are more like sleep camps.
Monuments/#Foreman_NotEnoughStonemasons: Impressive heap of stone, isn't it? And that's all it's ever going to be, unless some stonemasons show up. The Stonemasons' Guild in this city won't win any awards for productivity...
Monuments/#Foreman_NotEnoughBricklayers: Between you and me, the Bricklayers' Guild in this city must be some kind of recreation club. It's not sending me any bricklayers, that's for certain.
Monuments/#Foreman_NotEnoughCarpenters: I need a carpenter here, and I need him now! Why don't you apply your leadership skills at that good-for-nothing Carpenters' Guild?
Monuments/#Foreman_NotEnoughCarpenters_2: An awful lot of people are standing around waiting for a carpenter to show up. He sure does take his sweet time getting here.
Monuments/#Foreman_NoPlainstone: A stonemason without stone is sad to see. Quarry or import more plain stone, or this monument will never take form.
Monuments/#Foreman_NoLimestone: You had best quarry or import more limestone, if stonemasons are to build a monument during our lifetimes.
Monuments/#Foreman_NoSandstone: Unless the city imports or quarries more sandstone, our stonemason is going to enjoy an early retirement.
Monuments/#Foreman_NoGranite: It won't be much of a monument, with the paltry supply of granite I'm seeing. Quarry or import more of it.
Monuments/#Foreman_NoMarble: Unless you import more marble, our stonemasons will never be able to finish this monument.
Monuments/#Foreman_NoBricks: Our bricklayers need a lot more bricks than they're getting. If we can't make them, maybe you can import some.
Monuments/#Foreman_NoWood: My carpenters lament the shortage of wood. Cut more trees, or step up the imports.
Monuments/#Foreman_NoCopper: Our masons are ready to add copper to the roof if only it would arrive. Mine or import more of it.
Monuments/#Foreman_PyramidAndBentPyramid: Workers are just clearing and leveling the construction site now. This would be a fine time to amass some plain stone and limestone. We are going to need plenty.
Monuments/#Foreman_Pyramid_NoProblem: Everything seems to be going just fine, and the pyramid continues to rise higher and higher.
Monuments/#Foreman_BrickCorePyramid_Clea: Workers are just clearing and leveling the construction site now. After that, we'll need plenty of bricks and limestone to complete this monument.
Monuments/#Foreman_SteppedPyramid_ClearS: Workers are just clearing and leveling the construction site now. After that, we'll need plenty of plain stone to build this monument.
Monuments/#Foreman_Plainstone_Stockpiled: The Overseer of Commerce refuses to release plain stone to my workers. He claims that you ordered it to be stockpiled. I don't believe him, but perhaps you should straighten him out.
Monuments/#Foreman_Limestone_Stockpiled: Your Overseer of Commerce says that you commanded him to stockpile limestone. Unless you have a talk with him, my workers will never get any deliveries.
Monuments/#Foreman_Sandstone_Stockpiled: Did you really direct the Overseer of Commerce to stockpile sandstone? He will not authorize shipments from the Storage Yards.
Monuments/#Foreman_Marble_Stockpiled: Could you ask your Overseer of Commerce to stop stockpiling white marble? We could really use it on the monument.
Monuments/#Foreman_Granite_Stockpiled: Your Overseer of Commerce says that you commanded him to stockpile granite. Unless you have a talk with him, my workers will never get any deliveries.
Monuments/#Foreman_Bricks_Stockpiled: Your Overseer of Commerce dares to blame you for the work stoppage! He claims that you ordered bricks to be stockpiled.
Monuments/#Foreman_Copper_Stockpiled: The Overseer of Commerce told me that you have ordered him to stockpile copper. I'm sure you have a good reason for doing so, but my men can't continue work on the monument without the commodity.
Monuments/#Foreman_NoArtisans: The Pharaoh will not be the least bit amused if his life story is not told in the most elegant fashion. With no Artisans' Guild, whom do you expect to illustrate the tomb?
Monuments/#Foreman_NotEnoughArtisans: A rather drab looking tomb, isn't it? That's how it's going to stay unless some artisans show up soon! I always thought they were a lazy lot. You'd better see what the delay is.
Monuments/#Foreman_NoMarble_var: Without any marble, our talented stonemasons have nothing to do. That is a real shame, as I'd really like to see them much busier. You had better see to it that some marble gets imported quickly.
Monuments/#Foreman_NoCopper_var: The roof on this will leak like a sieve if we don't get some copper. If you can't mine it then you had better import some. The sooner I get it the sooner this monument will be done!
Monuments/#Foreman_NoProblem: Work is progressing nicely. The laborers have all the supplies they need.
Monuments/#Foreman_Marble_Stockpiled_var: It is hard to believe, but the Overseer of Commerce informs me that marble is being stockpiled in our storage yards.  Without marble, how can you expect work to continue?
Monuments/#Foreman_Granite_Stockpiled_va: I've learned from a reliable source that granite is being stockpiled.  Do you expect me to conjure up what I need from the sands of the Nile?  You had better see to it that some granite is made available to my stonemasons immediately.
Monuments/#Foreman_Copper_Stockpiled_var: Without a supply of copper how can you expect the roof of this great structure to be completed?  Incredible as it may seem, your Overseer of Commerce has told me that he's stockpiling it.
Monuments/#Library_Step_1: We're waiting for peasants to clear the land.
Monuments/#Library_Step_2: Now that the land is cleared, stonemasons are putting the foundation in place.
Monuments/#Library_Step_3: The foundation is complete, so now we can work on the floor.
Monuments/#Library_Step_4: We're erecting some columns now that the floor is laid.
Monuments/#Library_Step_5: Building a roof is the next step. The columns are complete.
Monuments/#Library_Step_6: Now we need some copper to finish the roof so that it will glisten like the sun.
Monuments/#Library_Step_7: We're just putting the finishing touches on the Library now.
Monuments/#Library_Completed: Alexandria's Library is finished and is the center of learning in the known world.
Monuments/#Library_Marble: The remainder of the Library will require an additional {0} blocks of marble ({1} loads).
Monuments/#Library_Copper: The remainder of the Library will require an additional {0} ingots of copper ({1} loads).
Monuments/#Caesareum_Step_1: Peasants are hard at work, clearing the land for the Caesareum.
Monuments/#Caesareum_Step_2: Now that the land is ready, the stonemasons are busy laying a solid foundation.
Monuments/#Caesareum_Step_3: Our tired stonemasons have finished laying the foundation. No rest for the weary, though: construction of the temple is underway.
Monuments/#Caesareum_Step_4: With the central temple complete, work has begun on the patio!
Monuments/#Caesareum_Step_5: From patios to porticos! Our skillful stonemasons have finished the patio and have begun work on the portico.
Monuments/#Caesareum_Step_6: The stonemasons have started placing the roof on the portico's pillars.
Monuments/#Caesareum_Step_7: All of the roof sections are in place on the porticos.
Monuments/#Caesareum_Step_8: The Caesareum's majestic entranceway is finished.
Monuments/#Caesareum_Step_9: Stonemasons have finished the Caesareum's interior and have turned their attention to the granite obelisks that adorn the exterior of the building.
Monuments/#Caesareum_Completed: The Caesareum is complete and celebrates the union between Egypt and Rome.
Monuments/#Caesareum_Marble: The remainder of the Caesareum will require an additional {0} blocks of marble ({1} loads).
Monuments/#Caesareum_Granite: The remainder of the Caesareum will require an additional {0} blocks of granite ({1} loads).
Monuments/#Pharos_Step_1: Peasants have begun the arduous task of clearing the land.
Monuments/#Pharos_Step_2: The stonemasons are busily laying the foundation for the Lighthouse.
Monuments/#Pharos_Step_3: The foundation is almost complete and the parquet floor is being installed.
Monuments/#Pharos_Step_4: With the parquet floor complete, the stonemasons have turned their attention to the first tier of the Lighthouse.
Monuments/#Pharos_Step_5: The stonemasons don't have much time to admire their work on the first tier, for work on the second octagonal tier will begin soon.
Monuments/#Pharos_Step_6: The Lighthouse is really beginning to take shape. The octagonal tier is done, and the stonemasons will begin the cupola soon.
Monuments/#Pharos_Step_7: The last piece of the Lighthouse had been laid in place, but the monument won't be complete until the scaffolding is removed. That work is beginning now.
Monuments/#Pharos_Step_8: Most of the scaffolding has been removed, and the Lighthouse is nearly complete.
Monuments/#Pharos_Completed: The Pharos Lighthouse is finished and shines as a beacon over the Eastern Mediterranean Sea.
Monuments/#Pharos_Marble: The remainder of the Lighthouse will require an additional {0} blocks of marble ({1} loads).
Monuments/#AbuSimbel_Working: Workers are busy working on Abu Simbel. Make sure that the carpenters have plenty of wood so that they can build scaffolding in a timely fashion.
Monuments/#AbuSimbel_Completed: The impressive figures of our Ramses II welcome all who approach Egypt from the south.
Monuments/#BurialTomb_NoLamps: The artisans and masons refuse to step foot in the Royal Burial Tomb without lamps. It is awfully dark in there!
Monuments/#BurialTomb_NoProblem: The artisans and masons are busy at their crafts, and work on the Royal Burial Tomb is progressing nicely. Remember to keep the Artisans' Guild supplied with clay and paint to help ensure that everything goes smoothly.
Monuments/#BurialTomb_NoBurialGoods: The Royal Burial Tomb is complete. All that is lacking now are the burial provisions the deceased will need in the Field of Reeds.
Monuments/#BurialTomb_Completed: The hidden Royal Burial Tomb is now ready for the Pharaoh. May Horus guard the tomb and strike down anyone who may dare to violate it!
Monuments/#BurialTomb_NoAccess: Workers can't get to the tomb's entrance. See what's blocking the way.
Names/Army/SeaPeople: an army of the Sea People

Overseers/#Politics_KingdomRating_0: Popular opinion would consign your remains to the jackals.
Overseers/#Politics_KingdomRating_5: You are popular among jugglers who use you in their comedies.
Overseers/#Politics_KingdomRating_10: It is widely believed that your very presence causes malaria.
Overseers/#Politics_KingdomRating_15: Apothecaries agree that your name is more bitter than any known herb.
Overseers/#Politics_KingdomRating_20: Mothers use your name to frighten their small children.
Overseers/#Politics_KingdomRating_25: Your name is never mentioned in polite company.
Overseers/#Politics_KingdomRating_30: Your reputation is base and your own family shuns you.
Overseers/#Politics_KingdomRating_35: Your name is recognized but ridiculed throughout the Two Lands.

Overseers/#Politics_KingdomRating_45: Few people in the Kingdom know your record and those who do are unimpressed.
Overseers/#Politics_KingdomRating_50: Those few people who recognize your name have no opinion of you.
Overseers/#Politics_KingdomRating_55: Your meager achievements aren't famous but those who know you generally like you.
Overseers/#Politics_KingdomRating_60: People who matter know of your history and generally approve of what you've done.
Overseers/#Politics_KingdomRating_65: Your name is widely recognized and applauded throughout the Two Lands.
Overseers/#Politics_KingdomRating_70: Your reputation is good and you are often approached by long-lost relatives.
Overseers/#Politics_KingdomRating_75: The mention of your name lightens the hearts of those who hear it.
Overseers/#Politics_KingdomRating_80: Mothers throughout the Kingdom name their children after you.
Overseers/#Politics_KingdomRating_85: Many Egyptian cities contemplate holding festivals in your honor.
Overseers/#Politics_KingdomRating_90: The most popular dance sweeping Egypt interprets the story of your life.
Overseers/#Politics_KingdomRating_95: Musicians compose songs to you and your name is carved on every public space.
Overseers/#Politics_KingdomRating_100: All people of Egypt wish to serve you eternally in the Field of Reeds.

Overseers/#Ratings_Prosperity_LowWages: Paying less than the Kingdom wage tarnishes your city's image as a prosperous one.
Overseers/#Ratings_Prosperity_Slums: The high concentration of slum dwellers in your city lends it the appearance of a poor one.
Overseers/#Ratings_Prosperity_NoTribute: Your inability to pay the annual tribute marks your city out as a failure.
Overseers/#Ratings_Prosperity_Advice: The city is more Prosperous when exports earn more than imports cost.

Overseers/#Ratings_Kingdom_VeryHighSalar: The ridiculously high salary that you pay yourself indicates your complete lack of dedication to the Kingdom, and reduces this rating.
Overseers/#Ratings_Kingdom_NoTribute3rd: Your continued inability to provide annual tribute lowers your reputation throughout the Kingdom, and reduces this rating.
Overseers/#Ratings_Kingdom_CanceledReque: The way you have responded to certain events has greatly harmed your reputation throughout the Kingdom, and lowered this rating.
Overseers/#Ratings_Kingdom_VeryHighSalar: The salary that you pay yourself, far exceeding your rank, reduces your reputation in the Kingdom.
Overseers/#Ratings_Kingdom_NoTribute2nd: For the second year in a row, you have not paid tribute, and your Kingdom rating suffers for it.
Overseers/#Ratings_Kingdom_RecentChanges: Your response to certain events has harmed your standing in the Kingdom a little.
Overseers/#Ratings_Kingdom_HighSalary: Your salary is too high for your current standing. Your Kingdom rating will rise if you reduce it somewhat.
Overseers/#Ratings_Kingdom_NoTribute1st: You could not pay your tribute this year, which reduced your Kingdom rating. Keep some money in your treasury at year's end so you can make your annual payment.
Overseers/#Ratings_Kingdom_HighSalary2: Your salary is too high for your current standing. You would do well to reduce it.
Overseers/#Ratings_Kingdom_UnmeetObjecti: Your slow progress toward meeting your goals in a timely fashion has reduced your Kingdom rating.
Overseers/#Ratings_Kingdom_HighSalary3: Your brazenness in paying yourself a salary higher than your rank entitles you to is frowned upon.

Overseers/#Ratings_Kingdom_NoChange: Your Kingdom rating is unchanged from last year. You can instruct your Political Overseer to give a gift to Egypt, and this rating will rise.

Overseers/#PublicHealth_MoreApothecaries: More and more people want convenient medical facilities (Apothecaries).

Overseers/#PublicHealth_NoProblem: Your small settlement has yet to report any problems with health.
Overseers/#PublicHealth_Desc_0: City health is appalling! Pestilence is certain in such shocking conditions.
Overseers/#PublicHealth_Desc_10: City health is terrible! Disease is almost inevitable.
Overseers/#PublicHealth_Desc_20: City health is bad. More health care workers might improve the situation.
Overseers/#PublicHealth_Desc_30: City health is poor. Plenty of food and health facilities would improve it.
Overseers/#PublicHealth_Desc_40: City health is below average. Make sure citizens have food, and access to health care providers.
Overseers/#PublicHealth_Desc_50: City health is average. Foul influences are under control, and people get enough to eat.
Overseers/#PublicHealth_Desc_60: City health is good. Citizens are prone to only minor ailments.
Overseers/#PublicHealth_Desc_70: City health is very good. Local caregivers are coping well.
Overseers/#PublicHealth_Desc_80: City health is excellent, with no waiting times at all to visit local health facilities.
Overseers/#PublicHealth_Desc_90: City health is almost perfect, with health facilities virtually empty.
Overseers/#PublicHealth_Desc_100: City health is perfect. Your health care workers spend most of their days playing senet.
Overseers/#Learning_SchoolNeeded: Certain areas of the city now need Scribal School access. Poor education prevents some residents from improving their housing.
Overseers/#Learning_MoreSchoolNeeded: Some neighborhoods demand better Scribal School access. Some houses have access to city schools, but others do not, and this hinders their development.
Overseers/#Learning_LibraryNeeded: Library access is now needed in certain areas of the city. People need access to literature if they are to work as scribes.
Overseers/#Learning_MoreLibraryNeeded: Some areas of the city want better Library access. Upper-class scribes do not appreciate having to walk so far to the Library.
Overseers/#Learning_MoreFacilitiesNeeded: Better Scribal School and Library access would enhance some areas of the city. People should not have to walk so far for an education!
Overseers/#Learning_NoFacilitiesNeeded: No one is asking for educational facilities yet. As the city grows in stature, though, people will expect Scribal Schools, followed later by demands for Libraries.
Overseers/#Learning_PerfectAccess: All homes that want them have educational facilities.  Scribal Schools and Libraries are numerous, and no one complains of overcrowding.
Overseers/#Learning_NoSchoolNeeded_NoCom: All homes that want them have educational facilities, but building more Scribal Schools would reduce classroom sizes and improve city Culture.
Overseers/#Learning_NoLibraryNeeded_NoCo: All homes that want them have educational facilities, but building more Libraries would reduce overcrowding and enhance city Culture.
Overseers/#Diversions_NoEntertainmentNee: No one is seeking entertainment yet. As your city grows, though, people will want amusements like juggling, music and dancing.
Overseers/#Diversions_NoMoreEntertainmen: There's currently enough diversion to satisfy everyone. As the city grows, though, people will ask for more and better forms of entertainment.
Overseers/#Diversions_SomeEntertainmentN: Some residents want more recreational facilities. More choices in diversions would motivate them to upgrade their homes.
Overseers/#Diversions_UnequalAccess: Parts of the city grumble that they have no access to recreation. Building more entertainment venues would help these poorer areas develop.
Overseers/#Diversions_UnequalAccess_2: Some people whine about inadequate entertainment in their neighborhoods. You may need to offer more variety, or perhaps build more performer schools to provide artists for venues that lack them.
Overseers/#Diversions_JugglerMusicanMiss: Some Booths or Bandstands have empty stages. More jugglers or musicians would satisfy neighborhoods that are complaining of poor entertainment.
Overseers/#Diversions_DancerMissing: Your Pavilions need more dancers. A new Dance school could boost local entertainment levels in parts of the city.
Overseers/#Temples_LastFestival: {[number]} months since last festival[I2p_One]1 month since last festival
Overseers/#Temples_NoFestivalYet: Your people have not celebreated any festival yet.
Overseers/#Temples_NoFestivalYet_Comment: People have yet to witness the greatness of a god's festival.
Overseers/#Temples_LastFestival_0: The hardiest revelers have not slept off the last festival yet.
Overseers/#Temples_LastFestival_3: People still smile when they remember your last festival.
Overseers/#Temples_LastFestival_6: The memory of the earlier festival is fading from people's minds.
Overseers/#Temples_LastFestival_12: People cannot remember the last festival to be held in the city.
Overseers/#Temples_LastFestival_24: Citizens grumble at the lack of festivals held in your city.
Overseers/#Temples_LastFestival_48: Your people cannot bear the prospect of another year without a festival.
Overseers/#Temples_LastFestival_96: Depressed residents doubt that they will live to see another festival.
Overseers/#Temples_NoTemples: Residents are beginning to feel spiritual needs. The absence of nearby places of worship holds back city development.
Overseers/#Temples_NoTemplesBadMood: More and more people fear that, without at least one place of worship in their neighborhoods, the gods will feel spurned.
Overseers/#Temples_SecondTempleNeeded: More sophisticated residents want access to another religion close to home. Lack of religious diversity limits city development in certain areas.
Overseers/#Temples_ThirdTempleNeeded: Discerning citizens say that their neighborhoods would attract a better class of scribe if they had easy access to a third religion.
Overseers/#Temples_NoTempleNeeded: So far, people are too preoccupied with physical needs to think about religion. As your city grows, though, they will want easy access to a variety of Temples.
Overseers/#Temples_PerfectCoverage: Everyone's particular religious beliefs are served, and the priests report that the gods are satisfied with the city's spirituality.
Overseers/#Temples_Displeased_Osiris: Osiris' displeasure is dangerous. He can destroy your crops and empty your Granaries, or even withhold the Inundation.
Overseers/#Temples_Displeased_Ra: When mighty Ra, father to Pharaoh, grows displeased, he will make your city's neighbors share his feeling. Ra's anger endangers harmony with the Kingdom.
Overseers/#Temples_Displeased_Ptah: Ptah, whose beneficence your manufacturers require, grows unhappy. Regain his favor, or brace your workers for the loss of whole industries and products.
Overseers/#Temples_Displeased_Seth: The bravest soldiers tremble before the wrath of Seth. Repair the god's opinion of your city quickly, or watch your battalion be swept away!
Overseers/#Temples_Displeased_Bast: When kind Bast becomes upset, people are not safe in their own homes. Placate the goddess swiftly, or destruction and pestilence will follow!

Overseers/#Chief_CitySentiment_9: People are very angry at you
Overseers/#Chief_CitySentiment_27: People are very upset with you
Overseers/#Chief_CitySentiment_72: People are very pleased with you.
Overseers/#Chief_CitySentiment_81: People are extremely pleased with you.
Overseers/#Chief_CitySentiment_99: People idolize you as a god.
Overseers/#Chief_CitySentiment_Reason_Fo:
Low City Sentiment contributes to higher crime rates, prevents settlers from 
coming to your city, and can even cause your current citizens to pick up and 
leave. The city's food shortage is the leading cause of unhappiness, but high taxes,
low wages, social inequality and lack of jobs may also be lowering City Sentiment.
Overseers/#Chief_CitySentiment_Reason_Jo:
Low City Sentiment contributes to higher crime rates, prevents settlers 
from coming to your city, and can even cause your current citizens to 
pick up and leave. The lack of jobs here upsets people more than anything 
else, but high taxes, low wages, social inequality and lack of food may also 
be lowering City Sentiment.
Overseers/#Chief_CitySentiment_Reason_Ta:
Low City Sentiment contributes to higher crime rates, prevents settlers 
from coming to your city, and can even cause your current citizens to 
pick up and leave. The high tax rate is foremost on your citizens' minds, 
but low wages, social inequality and lack of food and jobs may also be 
dragging down City Sentiment.
Overseers/#Chief_CitySentiment_Reason_Wa:
Low City Sentiment contributes to higher crime rates, prevents settlers from 
coming to your city, and can even cause your current citizens to pick up and 
leave. Their paltry wages (compared to what workers make elsewhere in Egypt)
are their main complaint, but high taxes, social inequality and lack of food 
and jobs may also be lowering City Sentiment.
Overseers/#Chief_CitySentiment_Reason_Sl:
Low City Sentiment contributes to higher crime rates, prevents settlers from 
coming to your city, and can even cause your current citizens to pick up and 
leave. Widespread social inequality angers people the most, but high taxes,
low wages and lack of food and jobs may also be depressing City Sentiment.
Overseers/#Chief_CitySentiment_Reason_Be:
Low City Sentiment contributes to higher crime rates, prevents settlers 
from coming to your city, and can even cause your current citizens to 
pick up and leave. Low wages, high taxes, social inequality and lack of 
food and jobs all contribute to low City Sentiment.
Overseers/#Chief_Migration_Normal: People are immigrating to the city.
Overseers/#Chief_Migration_Slums: The city's slum areas discourage immigration.
Overseers/#Chief_Migration_Leave_Nospace: Lack of vacant housing drives people away.
Overseers/#Chief_Migration_Leave_LowWage: Low wages are making people leave the city.
Overseers/#Chief_Migration_Leave_Unemplo: Unemployment makes people abandon the city.
Overseers/#Chief_Migration_Leave_NoFood: People who are leaving cite hunger as the reason.
Overseers/#Chief_Migration_Leave_HighTax: Unfair or excessive taxation drives people away.
Overseers/#Chief_Migration_Leave_Slums: Having some slums is encouraging people to leave.
Overseers/#Chief_Migration_Leave_PoorCit: People are leaving because of poor City Sentiment.
Overseers/#Chief_Migration_Nospace_hover:
As long as there is vacant housing, and the residents of your city are 
happy with you, more people will come to settle in your city.
Create more housing areas to let your city grow and prosper.
Overseers/#Chief_Migration_LowWages_hove:
As long as the residents of your city are happy with you, and sufficient 
housing is available, more people will come to settle in your city.
Raise wages if you want to lure more people to the city.
Overseers/#Chief_Migration_NoJobs_hover:
As long as the residents of your city are happy with you, and sufficient 
housing is available, more people will come to settle in your city. Create 
some jobs by building more industries if you want to attract more people 
to the city.
Overseers/#Chief_Migration_NoFood_hover:
As long as the residents of your city are happy with you, and sufficient housing 
is available, more people will come to settle in your city. Produce more food 
than you currently are, if you want to attract more people to the city.
Overseers/#Chief_Migration_HighTaxes_hov:
As long as the residents of your city are happy with you, and sufficient 
housing is available, more people will come to settle in your city.
Lower taxes would attract more people to the city.
Overseers/#Chief_Migration_NoChange_hove:
Normally, you'll want to increase the population so your city can grow and prosper.
New settlers are attracted by vacant housing and higher City Sentiment.
Overseers/#Chief_Migration_Normal_hover:
Normally, you'll want to increase the population so your city can grow and prosper.
Because there is vacant housing available, and your people are happy with their 
lives here, new settlers are flocking to the city.
Overseers/#Chief_Migration_Slums_hover:
When there is too much of a gap between the haves and the have-nots, 
no one will want to come to your city. Provide better services to your 
poorer neighborhoods to create more of a balance between the wealthy 
and those of more modest means.
Overseers/#Chief_Migration_PoorCitySenti:
As long as the residents of your city are happy with you, and sufficient 
housing is available, more people will come to settle in your city.
Increase your City Sentiment in order to attract people to the city.
Overseers/#Chief_Migration_Leave_Nospace:
As long as sufficient housing is available, and the residents of your city 
are happy, more people will come to settle in your city (and your own 
citizens won't depart for greener pastures!). Build more housing in order 
for your city to grow and prosper.
Overseers/#Chief_Migration_Leave_LowWage:
As long as the residents of your city are happy with you, and sufficient housing 
is available, they'll remain in your city. Raise wages if you want to encourage 
people to stay.
Overseers/#Chief_Migration_Leave_Unemplo:
As long as the residents of your city are happy with you, and sufficient 
housing is available, they'll remain in your city. Create more jobs by 
building some more industries if you want to encourage people to stay.
Overseers/#Chief_Migration_Leave_NoFood_:
As long as the residents of your city are happy with you, and sufficient housing is available, 
they'll remain in your city. Given the size of your current population, you need to produce 
more food than you currently are, if you want to encourage people to stay.
Overseers/#Chief_Migration_Leave_HighTax:
As long as the residents of your city are happy with you, and sufficient housing 
is available, they'll remain in your city. Lower taxes will encourage people to stay.
Overseers/#Chief_Migration_Leave_Slums_h:
When there is too much of a gap between the haves and the have-nots, people tend to seek 
opportunities elsewhere. Provide better services to your poorer neighborhoods, to create 
more of a balance between the wealthy and those of more modest means.
Overseers/#Chief_Migration_Leave_PoorCit:
As long as the residents of your city are happy with you, and sufficient 
housing is available, more people will come to settle in your city (and 
your own citizens won't depart for greener pastures!). You need to 
increase your City Sentiment if you want people to stay here.

A severe labor shortage like this will bring your city to a grinding halt.
Shut down any unneeded industries, or attract more workers with vacant 
housing and a happy population.
Overseers/#Chief_Employment_Shortage_150:
A severe labor shortage will prevent your citizens from carrying out their 
daily functions. Shut down any unneeded industries, or attract more 
workers with vacant housing and a happy population.

Without enough workers to go around, your citizens have a difficult time 
performing their daily tasks.
Overseers/#Chief_Employment_Shortage_1_h:
Labor shortages can result in a reduction of goods and services throughout the city. 
Make your city more efficient by shutting down any unneeded industries, or attracting

Overseers/#Chief_Employment_Perfect_hove:
High unemployment can cause your otherwise happy citizens to depart the city in search of jobs,
while labor shortages can result in a reduction of goods and services throughout the city.

Overseers/#Chief_FoodStock_Supply3: IMPORTANT: Our food levels are low.
Overseers/#Chief_FoodStock_hover:
If your citizens miss too many meals, they'll become unhealthy 
(or they'll leave the city in search of a better lifestyle).
Make sure that your people are not eating more than they produce, 
and that you have adequate Granaries to store the harvested crops.

Overseers/#Chief_Health_30: IMPORTANT: City health is poor - there is a small risk of plague.
Overseers/#Chief_Health_0_hover:
With so many people in such poor health, widespread plague is almost certain to 
decimate the city. Build Physicians' offices and Mortuaries for the people who do 
not currently have access to the services provided by physicians and embalmers,
and make sure your citizens have adequate supplies of food.

With this many unhealthy people, widespread plague will probably strike 
soon, and could decimate the city. Build Physicians' offices and Mortuaries 
for the people who do not currently have access to the services provided
by physicians and embalmers, and make sure your citizens have adequate 
supplies of food.
Overseers/#Chief_Health_20_hover:
With this many unhealthy people in the city, it's hard for apothecaries and 
physicians to keep up. Your city runs the risk of widespread plague, which 
can devastate its population. Build Physicians' offices and Mortuaries for 
the people who do not currently have access to the services provided by 
physicians and embalmers, and make sure your citizens have adequate 
supplies of food.

Overseers/#Chief_Finances_MadeMoney: This year assets have risen by {0} Db.
Overseers/#Chief_Finances_EquivalentLast: We are doing about as well as last year.
Overseers/#Chief_Finances_LostMoney: This year assets have fallen by {0} Db.
Overseers/#Chief_Finances_LowTaxesCovera:
You are passing up a substantial amount of money because your city does 
not have enough tax collectors working the streets. Build more Tax Collectors, 
especially in areas of higher-level housing, and use the tax overlay to make 
sure that everyone is visited by a tax collector.
Overseers/#Chief_Finances_MadeMoney_hove:
If you run out of money, your treasury will borrow up to {0} debens. However, 
remaining in debt for long has very serious consequences. Taxes, exports 
and mining gold are the best ways to bring revenue to the city.
Overseers/#Chief_Finances_LostMoney_hove:
If you keep losing money, you'll have to tap your line of credit. The city's 
treasury can borrow up to {0} debens, but remaining in debt for very long 
has serious consequences. Taxes, exports and mining gold are the best
ways to bring revenue to the city.
Overseers/#Chief_Crime_80_hover:
This much theft can seriously drain your city's treasury, or even your own 
family savings! An adequate number of Courthouses and Police Stations 
helps prevent crime, and constables subdue any thieves they encounter.
Keeping your people happy is the best way to deter crime in the first place.
Overseers/#Chief_Crime_60_hover:
Frequent thefts can drain your city's treasury, or even your own family savings! 
Adequate Courthouses and Police Stations help prevent crime, and constables 
will subdue any thieves they encounter. Of course, keeping your people happy 
is the best way to deter crime in the first place.
Overseers/#Chief_Crime_40_hover:
Frequent thefts can weaken your city's finances, and even your own family's savings! 
Adequate Courthouses and Police Stations help prevent crime, and constables will 
subdue any thieves they encounter. Of course, keeping your people happy is the best 
way to deter crime in the first place.
Overseers/#Chief_Crime_0_hover:
Theft can harm your city's finances, and even your family savings! An adequate 
number of Courthouses and Police Stations helps prevent crime, and constables 
will subdue any thieves they encounter. Of course, keeping your people happy is 
the best way to ensure that they don't turn to crime in the first place.
Overseers/#Chief_Military_NoTroops: You have no companies to command.
Overseers/#Chief_Military_AttackComing: Enemies are closing in on the city.
Overseers/#Chief_Military_AttackSoon: Enemy troops are at our gates.
Overseers/#Chief_Military_NoRequestForTr: We have no request for military assistance abroad.
Overseers/#Chief_Military_NoTroops_hover: There are no military forces at our disposal.
Overseers/#Chief_Military_NoAttack_hover: If enemies were advancing toward our city, you would surely receive a message.
Overseers/#Chief_Military_AttackComing_h:
An enemy army is advancing to attack the city! It can be difficult or impossible to construct 
buildings while under attack, so prepare your defenses by building Walls, Towers, 
Gatehouses and Forts now, while you still can.
Overseers/#Chief_Military_AttackInProgre:
It's always best to be prepared for attacks, rather than try to conscript troops 
at the last minute. Hopefully we have adequate defenses to protect the city.
Overseers/#Chief_Military_RequestForTroo:
We have received a request for troops from a fellow Egyptian commander.
It is usually best to honor such requests, if you want to remain on good 
terms with the rest of the Kingdom. Consult the Political Overseer, as well 
as the Overseer of the Military, to dispatch troops.
Overseers/#Chief_Military_TroopsSent_hov:
Some of our troops are serving Egypt in far-off military campaigns.
It is generally good to support the Kingdom by sending troops to 
help out when needed, if you want to maintain your good name 
throughout Egypt.
Overseers/#Chief_Kingdom_Request_3: There are many outstanding requests upon our city.
Overseers/#Chief_Kingdom_Request_2: There are several outstanding requests upon our city.
Overseers/#Chief_Kingdom_Request_1: There are some outstanding requests upon our city.
Overseers/#Chief_Kingdom_Request_0: There are no outstanding requests upon our city.
Overseers/#Chief_Kingdom_hover_1:
Failure to fulfill requests from Pharaoh or your neighbors can have various 
ill effects. If you don't help out your fellow Egyptian cities in their time of 
need, they may succumb to poverty, or fall into the hands of our enemies.
To remain on good terms with your countrymen, respond to requests like 
these willingly and promptly.
Overseers/#Chief_Kingdom_hover_2:
If you don't aid your fellow Egyptian cities in their time of need, they may 
succumb to poverty, fall into the hands of their enemies, or suffer some 
other undesirable fate. This could adversely affect trade, prices, even 
your Kingdom status. To remain on good terms with your countrymen, 
it's best to respond to requests willingly and promptly.
Overseers/#Chief_Kingdom_hover_3:
To remain on good terms with your countrymen, respond willingly and promptly 
to any requests they may make in their time of need. If you fail they may succumb 
to poverty, fall into the hands of their enemies, or suffer some other undesirable 
fate. This could have detrimental effects on trade, prices, even your Kingdom status.
Overseers/#Chief_Nilometer_NextFloodStat: The next flood is likely to fail entirely.
The next flood is likely to be poor.
The next flood is likely to be mediocre.
The next flood is likely to be good.
The next flood is likely to be excellent.
The next flood is likely to be perfect.

Priests interpreting the Nilometer warn that this year's flood could fail entirely, and the rich, 
fertile mud of the Nile won't renew your fields. If your city depends on farming the flood plain 
for its food, this could put the very survival of your citizens in jeopardy. Worshipping Osiris, 
the god of the Nile flood, can help avoid this next year.

Seers foretell a poor flood this year. They fear that very little rich, fertile mud 
of the Nile won't renew your fields. If your city depends on farming the flood 
plain for its food, it could jeopardize the very survival of your citizens. Appeasing 
Osiris, the god of the Nile flood, can help avoid this next year.

Omens portend a mediocre flood this year. If they are right, the Nile will deposit 
only some rich, fertile mud on your fields. If your city depends on farming the 
flood plain for its food, this puts the very survival of your citizens in jeopardy.
Increased worship of Osiris, the god of the Nile flood, will help ensure that this 
doesn't happen again next year.

If seers read the Nilometers right, the good flood expected this year will deposit 
the rich and fertile mud of the Nile onto your city's fields. Make sure that Osiris, 
the god of the Nile flood, is kept appeased, or he may decide to withhold this 
blessing next year.

If your city depends on farming the flood plain for its food, the amount of rich and 
fertile mud that omens indicate could be deposited on your fields by an excellent 
flood is a bounty not to be taken for granted. Make sure that Osiris, the god of the 
Nile flood, is kept happy, so that he will bestow this blessing again.

If your city depends on farming the flood plain for its food, the abundant rich and fertile 
mud that priests hope will be deposited on your fields this year by the perfect flood is 
an immeasurable bounty not to be taken for granted. Pray to Osiris, the god of the Nile 
flood, that this might happen again in the future.
Overseers/#Chief_Nilometer_June_1: The flood is expected to come in early June.
Overseers/#Chief_Nilometer_June_15: The flood is expected to come in late June.
Overseers/#Chief_Nilometer_July_1: The flood is expected to come in early July.
Overseers/#Chief_Nilometer_July_15: The flood is expected to come in late July.
Overseers/#Chief_Nilometer_August_1: The flood is expected to come in early August.
Overseers/#Chief_Nilometer_August_15: The flood is expected to come in late August.
Overseers/#Chief_Nilometer_September_1: The flood is expected to come in early September.
Overseers/#Chief_Nilometer_September_15: The flood is expected to come in late September.
Overseers/#Monuments_BurialProvisionsNee: Burial Provisions needed to finish the monument:
Overseers/#Monuments_NoBurialNeeded: No burial provisions need to be dispatched.
Overseers/#Monuments_VisitConstructionSi: Visit the construction site for more details.
Overseers/#Monuments_Pyramid_NotStarted: Work on this pyramid has not begun. You need peasant labor to begin this project, and plenty of plain stone and limestone to complete it.
Overseers/#Monuments_Pyramid_CompletedNo: This pyramid is complete. It will forever house sacred remains.
Overseers/#Monuments_BrickPyramid_NotSta: Work on this brick pyramid has not begun. You need peasant labor to begin this project, and plenty of bricks and limestone to complete it.
Overseers/#Monuments_BrickPyramid_Comple: This brick pyramid is now complete!
This pyramid is complete. It will forever house sacred remains.
Overseers/#Monuments_SteppedPyramid_NotS: Work on this stepped pyramid has not begun. You need peasant labor to begin this project, and plenty of plain stone to complete it.
Overseers/#Monuments_SteppedPyramid_Comp: This stepped pyramid is now complete!
This stepped pyramid is done. It will forever house sacred remains.
Overseers/#Monuments_BentPyramid_NotStar: Work on this bent pyramid has not begun. You need peasant labor to begin this project, and plenty of plain stone and limestone to complete it.
Overseers/#Monuments_BentPyramid_Complet: This bent pyramid is now complete!
This bent pyramid is done. It will forever house sacred remains.
Overseers/#Monuments_Mastaba_NotStarted: Work on this mastaba has not yet begun. You need peasant labor to begin this project, and a good supply of bricks to complete it.
Overseers/#Monuments_Mastaba_CompletedNo: This mastaba is complete, and will forever house sacred remains.
Overseers/#Monuments_Sphinx_NotStarted: Work on this sphinx has not yet begun. You need carpenters, stonemasons and wood to begin this project.
Overseers/#Monuments_Obelisk_NotStarted: Work on this obelisk has not yet begun. You will need blocks of granite to begin this project.
Overseers/#Monuments_SunTemple_NotStarte: Work on this sun temple has not yet begun. You will need blocks of sandstone to begin this project.
Overseers/#Monuments_SunTemple_Completed: This sun temple is now complete!
Overseers/#Monuments_Mausoleum_NotStarte: Work on this mausoleum has not yet begun. You will need blocks of sandstone to begin this project.
Overseers/#Monuments_Mausoleum_Completed: This mausoleum is complete, and will forever house sacred remains.
Overseers/#Monuments_Library_NotStarted: Work on Alexandria's Library has not begun. You will need peasant labor to begin this project, and a supply of marble and copper to complete it.
Overseers/#Monuments_Library_Completion: The Library of Alexandria is {0}% complete
Overseers/#Monuments_Library_Completed: The Library of Alexandria is now complete!
Overseers/#Monuments_Caesareum_NotStarte: Work on the Caesareum has not begun. You will need peasant labor to begin this project, and a supply of marble and granite to complete it.
Overseers/#Monuments_Pharos_NotStarted: Work on the Pharos Lighthouse has not begun. You will need peasant labor to begin this project, and a supply of marble to complete it.
Overseers/#Monuments_Pharos_Completed: The Pharos Lighthouse is now complete!
Overseers/#Monuments_AbuSimbel_NotStarte: Work on Abu Simbel has not begun. You will need carpenters, stonemasons and a supply of wood to begin this project.
Overseers/#Monuments_SmallBurialTomb_Not: Work on the Small Burial Tomb has not begun. You will need stonemasons, artisans, clay, paint and lamps to begin this project.
Overseers/#Monuments_SmallBurialTomb_Com: The Small Royal Burial Tomb is {0}% complete
The Small Royal Burial Tomb is now complete!
Overseers/#Monuments_MediumBurialTomb_No: Work on the Medium Burial Tomb has not begun. You will need stonemasons, artisans, clay, paint and lamps to begin this project.
Overseers/#Monuments_MediumBurialTomb_Co: The Medium Royal Burial Tomb is {0}% complete
The Medium Royal Burial Tomb is now complete!
Overseers/#Monuments_LargeBurialTomb_Not: Work on the Large Burial Tomb has not begun. You will need stonemasons, artisans, clay, paint and lamps to begin this project.
Overseers/#Monuments_LargeBurialTomb_Com: The Large Royal Burial Tomb is {0}% complete
The Large Royal Burial Tomb is now complete!
Overseers/#Monuments_GrandBurialTomb_Not: Work on the Grand Burial Tomb has not begun. You will need stonemasons, artisans, clay, paint and lamps to begin this project.
Overseers/#Monuments_GrandBurialTomb_Com: The Grand Royal Burial Tomb is {0}% complete
The Grand Royal Burial Tomb is now complete!
Overseers/#Politics_Choose_Send_Company: Choose troops to send for this request
Overseers/#Politics_Choose_Troop_Request: Choose where to send your company
Overseers/#Fort_Not_Built_Explained: You must build a new fort to create a new company
Overseers/#Company_tooltip_none: This company does not exist. Build a fort to create a new company.
Overseers/#Company_Tooltip_Part1_Warship: A combat warship. Needed to fight sea invasion.
Overseers/#Company_Tooltip_Part1_Transpo: A transport ship. Needed to send troops by sea to another city.
Overseers/#Company_Tooltip_Part2_No_Expe: It has no experience of combat.
Overseers/#Company_Tooltip_Part4_Availab: Currently training, ready to defend the city.
Overseers/#Company_Tooltip_Part5: Click here to center view on the fort.
Overseers/#Company_Tooltip_Cursed: This company is cursed by Seth
Overseers/#Company_Tooltip_Sent_Button: Send this company to defend a distant city.
Overseers/#Company_Tooltip_No_Sent_Butto: There is no distant city to defend
Overseers/#Company_Tooltip_Sent_Button_N: The city does not have enough transport ships available to send troops.
Overseers/#Company_Tooltip_No_Soldier: This company does not have any soldiers.
Overseers/#Monuments_BurialGoods_hover: Click to dispatch these burial provisions
Overseers/#Monuments_BurialGoodsDelivere: These burial provisions have already been delivered
Religion/#Festival_Soon: That festival put everyone into such good spirits, the city should hold another one soon.
Religion/#Festival_Since_1: It's been a few months since the last festival. This would be a good time for another.
Religion/#Festival_Since_2: There have been no festivals for quite some time, people are starting to complain.
Religion/#Festival_Since_3: It's been more than a year since the last festival. People feel bored and overworked.
Religion/#Festival_Since_4: It's been almost two years since the last festival. The people desperately need a break.
Religion/#Festival_Since_5: More than two years have passed with no festivals! People are starting to feel hopeless.
Religion/#Festival_Since_6: People talk wistfully of 'the good old days', when festivals used to relieve the monotony.
Religion/#Festival_Wonderful: That was such a wonderful festival! It takes a lot of time to prepare a gala like that.
Religion/#Festival_Preparation_1: Festivals take so much time and effort to prepare that it might be wise to order one now.
Religion/#Festival_Preparation_2: The last festival was long enough ago that it's just about time to order another.
Religion/#Festival_Small_In_1: The common festival is nearly ready. People are all talking about next month's holiday.
Religion/#Festival_Small_In_2: The common festival is being prepared. Just two more months until everyone gets a holiday!
Religion/#Festival_Small_In_3: Preparations for the common festival being held in three months will begin next month.
Religion/#Festival_Small_In_4: Festival organizers are firming up plans for the common festival coming in four months.
Religion/#Festival_Small_In_5: The common festival will take place in five months. Organizers are reviewing suggestions.
Religion/#Festival_Small_In_6: Planners are confident that they will be ready for a common festival in six more months.
Religion/#Festival_Small_In_7: Harried organizers promise that your common festival will be held seven months from now.
Religion/#Festival_Small_In_8: The common festival won't occur for another eight months. Planning has barely even begun.
Religion/#Festival_Small_In_9: Festival organizers are so busy that your requested common festival is nine months away.
Religion/#Festival_Small_In_10: Another one already? It will be ten months before organizers can hold a common festival.
Religion/#Festival_Lavish_In_1: The lavish festival is almost ready. People are excited about next month's celebration!
Religion/#Festival_Lavish_In_2: The lavish festival is being prepared, and we have only two more months to get ready.
Religion/#Festival_Lavish_In_3: The lavish festival is being readied. In three months, we'll have a memorable celebration.
Religion/#Festival_Lavish_In_4: Planners have hit their stride, and the lavish festival will surely occur in four months.
Religion/#Festival_Lavish_In_5: Entertainers are polishing their acts for the lavish festival to be held in five months.
Religion/#Festival_Lavish_In_6: Planners confirm that the new lavish festival will take place in six months, as promised.
Religion/#Festival_Lavish_In_7: Organizers are weighing public suggestions for the lavish festival coming in seven months.
Religion/#Festival_Lavish_In_8: Some entertainers are working out new routines for the lavish festival eight months hence.
Religion/#Festival_Lavish_In_9: With so much planning left to do, the lavish festival won't occur for another nine months.
Religion/#Festival_Lavish_In_10: Because no one has time to devote to it yet, the lavish festival will occur in ten months.
Religion/#Festival_Lavish_In_11: Planners are so busy that they have to schedule the new lavish festival eleven months out.
Religion/#Festival_Grand_In_1: The grand festival is nearly ready. In one more month, it'll be fresh beer for everyone.
Religion/#Festival_Grand_In_2: The grand festival's preparation has two months left. The anticipation is unbearable!
Religion/#Festival_Grand_In_3: The grand festival is being readied. People have only three more months to make plans.
Religion/#Festival_Grand_In_4: The grand festival is being prepared. No one wants to wait the four months planners need!
Religion/#Festival_Grand_In_5: Organizers can start preparations next month, enabling a grand festival in five months.
Religion/#Festival_Grand_In_6: Jugglers will unveil some real surprises at the grand festival, just six months from now.
Religion/#Festival_Grand_In_7: Musicians are all writing new songs for the grand festival, now only seven months away.
Religion/#Festival_Grand_In_8: Dancers can be seen rehearsing daring new moves for the grand festival, eight months out.
Religion/#Festival_Grand_In_9: Planners have mustered enough ideas and energy to throw a grand festival in nine months.
Religion/#Festival_Grand_In_10: Festival organizers are working overtime to ready the new grand festival in ten months.
Religion/#Festival_Grand_In_11: Planners are confident that they can properly throw a grand festival in eleven months.
Religion/#Festival_Grand_In_12: Organizers are so overworked that the grand festival you ordered will be a year from now.
Religion/#Osiris_flavor: God of Agriculture and the Nile Flood
Religion/#Festival_Start_Small_Content: Everyone appreciates getting out of work early to relax for a while at the Festival Square, and your chosen god notices your kind gesture.
Religion/#Festival_Start_Lavish_Content: The day-long festival is starting. People all over the city are heading for the Festival Square now, and seem to be in good spirits. Your chosen god appreciates your dedication.
Religion/#Festival_Start_Grand_Content: The much-anticipated two-day festival is under way at last! Everyone's converging on the Festival Square for free beer and wild entertainment. The god honored by this event is surely smiling upon you.
Religion/#Wrath_Major_Bast_Fire: Terrible news! Because your city neglects to show her the honor she is due, Bast, Goddess of the Home, leveled some of its best houses!
Religion/#Wrath_Major_Osiris_DestroyFarm: The lord of the Nile flood will punish this city for its lack of devotion, and next year's flood will destroy all farms in its path!
Religion/#Wrath_Major_Osiris_NoFlood: Terrible news! Because your city neglects to show him the honor he is due, Osiris, God of Agriculture, made sure that there would be no Inundation this year!
Religion/#Wrath_Major_Ptah_Storage: Dismayed by your disinterest in him, Ptah destroys one of your Storage Yards and whatever goods it held.
Religion/#Wrath_Major_Ra_Kingdom: Ra punishes your arrogance by severely lowering your reputation throughout the Kingdom. As you spurned the god, so shall other Egyptians belittle you.
Religion/#Wrath_Major_Seth_NavyFail: Your city escaped the anger of Seth by having no military assets for the god to destroy. Be wary, nonetheless, of provoking the God of Destruction, for his anger takes many forms and his memory is long.
Religion/#Wrath_Major_Seth_Navy: Your disregard for Seth prompts the god to destroy all of your ships!
Religion/#Wrath_Minor_Osiris_WorstFlood: Osiris reminds you that respect is due. The next Inundation will be poorer than we had expected.
Religion/#Wrath_Minor_Ra_Kingdom: Angered by your disrespect for him, Ra lowers your own reputation in the eyes of the Kingdom.
Religion/#Wrath_Minor_Ra_Trade: As you have spurned Ra, so shall your trade partners spurn your city's goods. They have decided to reduce the amount they are willing to trade with you.
Religion/#Wrath_Minor_Ra_Trade_var: You incurred Ra's anger! The god lowered the opinion of your city's goods, and your trade partners will now trade far less than they did previously.
Religion/#Wrath_Minor_Ptah_Industry: Ptah takes offense at your pride in believing that your city can be industrious without paying him respect. He destroyed some industrial buildings as a reminder to you.
Religion/#Wrath_Minor_Ptah_IndustryFail: You have incurred the anger of Ptah! Your city currently has no industries to punish, but mind this god carefully when you start mining, manufacturing or quarrying.
Religion/#Wrath_Minor_Seth_Fort: To remind you that Seth protects only those who show the proper respect, the god destroys your best company of soldiers and razes their Fort.
Religion/#Wrath_Minor_Seth_FortFail: Your city escaped the anger of Seth by having no military assets for the god to destroy. Be wary, nonetheless, of provoking the God of Destruction, for his anger takes many forms and his memory is long.
Religion/#Wrath_Minor_Bast_FullHouses: The goddess Bast, stung by your indifference, sends a plague to stalk your city. Remember that health and happiness flow from her.
Religion/#Blessing_Major_Bast_FullHouses: Because this city is so faithful and dedicated, Bast blesses its houses and Bazaars with a bounty of food and goods!
Religion/#Blessing_Major_Osiris_DoubleHa: Osiris, god of the Nile flood, blesses this city for its sincere devotion. All farms on the flood plain will harvest double what they had expected this season!
Religion/#Blessing_Major_Osiris_PerfectF: Osiris rewards those who pay him worship. The next Inundation will be significantly better than we were expecting.
Religion/#Blessing_Major_Ptah_StorageFai: Ptah sought a Storage Yard with room for more gems, clay, pottery, flax, linen, or jewelry. Had he found one, he would have increased your city's stores.
Religion/#Blessing_Major_Ptah_Storage: Ptah singles out a Storage Yard with excess capacity, and increases the gems, clay, pottery, flax, linen, or jewelry already present there.
Religion/#Blessing_Major_Ra_Trade: Ra rewards his faithful! For the next 12 months, your city can sell its exports for half again their usual value.
Religion/#Blessing_Major_Ra_Kingdom: You have honored Ra, and so your reputation throughout the Kingdom is substantially better than it was!
Religion/#Blessing_Major_Seth_Kill: Seth approves of your fear and obedience, and so will strike down some of the next enemies who dare to violate your city.
Religion/#Blessing_Major_Seth_Kill_Event: Seth remembers his promise to protect you, and is delighted to slay those who were foolish enough to threaten your city, your attackers are now less numerous!
Religion/#Blessing_Minor_Bast_Festival: Bast is pleased that your city honors her. She has thrown a festival so that all the gods will notice your piety.
Religion/#Blessing_Minor_Osiris_BetterFl: Osiris has noticed your city's faithful dedication. The next Inundation of the Nile will be better than previously expected.
Religion/#Blessing_Minor_Ptah_Stock: Ptah is pleased by your attention, and so ensures that Shipwrights, Weavers or Jewelers throughout your city are fully stocked with raw materials.
Religion/#Blessing_Minor_Ra_Kingdom: Encouraged by your proper awe, Ra lifts your reputation somewhat throughout the Kingdom.
Religion/#Blessing_Minor_Ra_Trade: To acknowledge your respectful attitude, Ra inspires your trading partners to trade more than before.
Religion/#Blessing_Minor_Seth_Protect: To reward your obedience to him, Seth vows to protect any of your soldiers sent to battle in far-off lands.
Religion/#Blessing_Minor_Seth_Protect_Co: Seth remembers his promise and will protect your troops in the battle to come. Whatever the result all your soldiers will come back safe to the city!
Religion/#Wrath_Major_Ptah_StorageFail: Your city escaped the anger of Ptah by having no Storage Yard for the god to burn. Be wary, nonetheless, of provoking the God of Craftsmen, for his anger takes many forms and his memory is long.
Tutorial/Nubt_Step_01_Content: The first things this village will need are housing, to provide settlers with a suitable place to live, and a network of roads, to allow its eventual inhabitants to find their way around easily and efficiently. Build areas of housing, and you'll soon see people move into the village.
Tutorial/Nubt_Step_02_Title: Use the right panel to access construction tools.
Tutorial/Nubt_Step_03_Title: Click & drag to place areas of housing.
Tutorial/Nubt_Step_04_Title: Right-click to quit the construction mode.
Tutorial/Nubt_Step_05_Title: Select the road button on the right panel
Tutorial/Nubt_Step_06_Title: Click and drag the mouse to build long lengths of road in one go.
Tutorial/Nubt_Step_07_Content: The path by which immigrants reach your city is known as the Kingdom road. Migrants always need free passage from the Kingdom road to the city's housing areas. If you isolate a neighborhood from this vital link to the outside world, its homes will simply disappear.
Tutorial/Nubt_Step_08_Title: Watch immigrants arrive until your city grows to 200 inhabitants.
Tutorial/Nubt_Step_09_Content: To evolve their houses, your inhabitants will need basic access to water. Some well placed wells will provide them with everything they need.
