Wells must be built on land with underlying groundwater, as indicated by the presence of green grass growing, and provide water within a 2-tile radius of themselves.
Tutorial/Nubt_Step_10_Title: Select the service category on the right panel
Tutorial/Nubt_Step_11_Title: Select the hygiene subcategory on the right panel
Tutorial/Nubt_Step_14_Title: Right-click to go back to the category selection, and right-click again to quit the construction mode.
Tutorial/Nubt_Step_15_Content: If you’d rather have all the subcategories already open when you select a category, you can choose to do so in the options. This will have no effect on Nubt but the changes will occur for subsequent missions.
Tutorial/Nubt_Step_16_Title: Watch your houses evolve until 250 inhabitants live in sturdy huts.
Tutorial/Nubt_Step_17_Content: A growing population needs a reliable source of food and some means of storing and distributing it. The ostriches in this region can be hunted for game. You’ll need hunting lodges for that. Granaries then store game meat and other foods, while Bazaars distribute the food to the village's inhabitants.
Tutorial/Nubt_Step_21_Content: As with most working structures, these buildings must be located within reach of housing, and the city must have enough workers to staff them. Watch as the buildings spawn a walker to look for workers, and how they turn animated once their walkers pass by occupied houses. You can click on a placed hunting lodge to get more information.
Tutorial/Nubt_Step_23_Content: Hunters will now set out in search of prey. If successful, they'll bring the carcasses back to the lodge to be butchered, after which a cart pusher will deliver them to the nearest Granary for storage, which we’re going to build now. Granaries are somewhat undesirable to leave nearby but will need access to the workforce, so it's important to place them carefully.
Tutorial/Nubt_Step_26_Title: Build it far away enough from your houses but close enough so it has access to the workforce
Tutorial/Nubt_Step_27_Content: While your hunters now deliver game meat to the granary, you still have no way to distribute it to your inhabitants. That’s the job of the Bazaar. The Bazaar will send one of its workers to the granary to bring back food and will then send its distributor roaming the roads to deliver it to your citizens.
Tutorial/Nubt_Step_29_Title: Build a Bazaar near your housing and make sure it’s connected by road to your granary.
Tutorial/Nubt_Step_30_Content: When trying to place a building near a road, you will see indicators with arrows. The green arrow shows where the building will spawn its walkers and where it will take deliveries of goods. The red arrow shows the point of return for distributors coming out of the building. Sometimes both points are on the same tile. The points might change when you build new roads next to existing buildings - you can check them at any time by simply hovering your cursor on the structure you want to inspect.
Tutorial/Nubt_Step_32_Content: Distributors of goods or services will roam the roads of your city for a period of time, and then return o their building. During their walk, if they reach a crossroad, they can take either direction. To avoid distributors getting lost or going where you don’t want them to, don’t build a road network with too many intersections. This is also true for recruiters, so place your buildings accordingly.
Tutorial/Nubt_Step_33_Content: One of the tools at your disposal that you can use to control the walkers is the roadblock. Roadblocks prevent distributors and recruiters from passing but do not affect other walkers with a set destination. Use roadblocks wisely and you’ll be able to manage gigantic cities.
Tutorial/Nubt_Step_34_Title: Select the roadblock button on the right panel
Tutorial/Nubt_Step_35_Title: A couple of roadblocks will prevent walkers from wandering too far from your burgeoning city.
Tutorial/Nubt_Step_36_Content: To make sure Nubt sustains the tests of time, you’ll need to make sure that the structures in the village don’t catch fire or collapse on themselves. Not all buildings are prone to risks, the best way to tell if one will need to be visited by either an architect from an architect's post or a fire marshal from a firehouse is to click on it and open its panel info. Houses, for example, will catch fire if not attended to, but will never collapse on themselves.
Tutorial/Nubt_Step_39_Title: You can now freely place buildings
Tutorial/Nubt_Step_40_Title: Place a fire house and an architect's post to protect your buildings
Tutorial/Nubt_Step_41_Title: Use the Remove button on the right panel if you misplace a building or a road
Tutorial/Nubt_Step_42_Content: Now that they have food, villagers need access to clean water from a Water Supply, which is much preferred over water from Wells. Water Supplies must be built on grassy areas and also need access to employees in nearby housing. Once up and running, a Water Supply will dispatch a water carrier to deliver buckets of clean drinking water to all the houses in its immediate vicinity.
Tutorial/Nubt_Step_45_Title: Supply enough of your inhabitants with clean water to win the game
Tutorial/Nubt_Step_46_Title: Reach 6 meager shanties to complete this mission
Tutorial/Thinis_Step_01_Content: Start to lay down your housing and provide your people with fresh water and food the same way you did in Nubt. Try to stay relatively close to those ore-bearing rocks in the northwest of the map—you’re going to need to mine them! You can clear trees with the Remove button, but these won’t grow back. In future missions, you’ll have to make sure you won’t need them before getting rid of them.
Tutorial/Thinis_Step_02_Title: Build housing and evolve it to reach at least 10 meager shanties
Tutorial/Thinis_Step_03_Content:
You might sometimes feel the need to speed things up a bit or pause the game if a lot is happening at once. All the buttons you need are located on the top-left panel. They have their own keyboard shortcuts that you can modify in the options.
Set up your shortcuts in the way that is most comfortable for you!
Tutorial/Thinis_Step_04_Title: Build housing and evolve it to reach at least 10 meager shanties
Tutorial/Thinis_Step_05_Content: Each structure you place costs debens, not counting what you will spend to pay the workers’ salaries. One way to make back that money is to mine gold. Place at least 2 goldmines near veins of ore so you can start production of this precious metal. Make sure they have access to the workforce and don’t forget to protect them against collapse risk!
Tutorial/Thinis_Step_07_Content: Gold is a special resource that is stored in the Palace, a unique building that also vaults the city’s treasury. You can only build one Palace, and it must be constructed on grassy areas. Each gold carrier reaching your palace will add 100 debens to the city funds. With this regular income, you should not have to worry about debt.
Tutorial/Thinis_Step_08_Title: Have your mines deliver gold to your palace
Tutorial/Thinis_Step_9_Content: With a supply of cash in reserve, however, comes the risk of theft. Constables from a police station can help reduce losses through theft, both by patrolling the streets to prevent crime and by subduing any criminals they encounter. The best way to prevent crime, though, is to keep your population happy with adequate food, health care and jobs.
Tutorial/Thinis_Step_10_Title: Build a police station to patrol your housing and your Palace
Tutorial/Thinis_Step_11_Content: You can check your houses by clicking on them to see if there is a risk of crime, but sometimes you’ll need to be able to see in one glance if there is any problem in the entire city. This is where overlays on the left bar will help you. Try the crime overlay first, you'll then be able to explore a few of them.
Tutorial/Thinis_Step_12_Title: Open the overlay menu on the left panel
Tutorial/Thinis_Step_14_Content: Crime isn’t the only challenge you will face. Health can cause problems, and decimate your citizens. Physicians patrolling a neighborhood will protect its inhabitants from diseases. Providing your population with food and fresh water will also reduce the risk of diseases. Other structures will help your citizens' health going forward. The Apothecary will protect houses against malaria in cities with marshes nearby, for example.
Tutorial/Thinis_Step_15_Title: Place a physician to protect your citizens from diseases
Tutorial/Thinis_Step_16_Content: An Egyptian city cannot truly flourish without suitable places of worship, in the form of religious Temples and Shrines dedicated to one of five gods. The patron god of Thinis is Bast. To appease the gods, build enough Temples and Shrines dedicated to each of them to serve your current population. A working Temple sends a priest through nearby neighborhoods, granting residents access to the worship of his god. In addition to their religious effect, Shrines and Temples also provide a good amount of desirability for houses nearby. Shrines can be built one tile away from roads and still function properly.
Tutorial/Thinis_Step_17_Title: Build a temple dedicated to Bast
Tutorial/Thinis_Step_18_Content: Both patron gods and local deities can become hostile if not shown the respect due their positions. First, you need to make sure you have enough Temples and Shrines for your current population. Patron gods will require twice the amount. Festivals are another way to appease the gods. Build a Festival Square in the city to unlock the possibility of holding a festival.
Tutorial/Thinis_Step_19_Title: Build a Festival Square on an intersection.
Tutorial/Thinis_Step_20_Content: Consult the Overseer of the Temples to determine the status of each of the gods in any particular city, and whether the gods are sufficiently appeased. Lightning bolts indicate that the god is feeling hostile toward your city, while a blue mystic symbol indicates that the god is feeling benevolent toward your city. The more you see of either, the more likely your city is to feel the god's presence (for better or for worse!). There are different overseers available on the left panel to help you govern your city, check them from time to time, they should be able to answer most of your questions!
Tutorial/Thinis_Step_21_Title: Open the Overseer menu on the left panel
Tutorial/Thinis_Step_22_Title: Open the Temple Overseer and hold a festival for Bast
Tutorial/Thinis_Step_23_Title: While preparations for the festival are underway, you can speed up time
Tutorial/Thinis_Step_24_Content: As your city becomes more advanced, some citizens can enjoy leisure-time activities, such as taking in a little entertainment. A wide assortment of entertainment is one of the hallmarks of a truly cultured city, but currently, you can only provide entertainment in the form of Jugglers. The Juggler needs a venue in which to perform, the smallest of which is called a Booth. Build a Booth on the corner of a road to stage juggling performances, and a Juggler School nearby to train performers. Both need access to employee housing, and enough workers to staff them. Jugglers trained at the Juggler School will proceed to any nearby Booth to put on shows, imparting a modest amount of entertainment to the surrounding area as they pass by.
Tutorial/Thinis_Step_25_Title: Reach ordinary cottages to win the mission!
Tutorial/Thinis_Step_26_Title: Use Shrines and Temples to make the area more desirable for houses that cannot evolve despite access to entertainment
Tutorial/Thinis_Step_FlatMode_Content: Temples are tall buildings and tend to hide what’s directly behind them. Over the course of the game, you’ll get access to more structures that can have that effect, from Courthouses to, of course, huge Pyramids. This is where we meet one of your most important tools: The Flat Mode. Flat Mode can be activated with the button located next to your mini-map, or by simply pressing the ‘F’ key (by default). It will flatten all built structures while allowing you to keep building new ones.
Tutorial/Thinis_Step_Next_Title: Build two shrines dedicated to Bast
Tutorial/Perwadjyt_Step_01_Content: To feed your people in Perwadjyt, you must build farms directly on the flood plain, in order to gain the benefits of its increased fertility. Unlike most working structures, farms on the flood plain do not need direct access to employees, but do need a steady workforce of peasant laborers, supplied by Work Camps, to tend their fields. Build Work Camps fairly close to flood plain farms, so peasants won't have to walk too far to reach them. Each year the Nile floods its banks, replenishing the depleted soil on the flood plain with rich, fertile mud. Peasants harvest the annual crop just before the inundation, and deliver it to your Granaries. Because there is only one harvest per year, make sure your city has enough Granaries to store a sufficient amount of food for your growing population.
Tutorial/Perwadjyt_Step_02_Title: Start building your city along with some farms and work camps
Tutorial/Perwadjyt_Step_03_Content: Malaria is most prevalent close to water and marshland. The Malaria overlay shows which houses are more likely to succumb to this illness. Access to clean water from a Water Supply and insect repellent provided by a local Apothecary both greatly reduce the risk of malaria for any given household. Like most buildings, the Apothecary only functions when it has road access and labor.
Tutorial/Perwadjyt_Step_04_Title: Protect your citizens with an Apothecary
Tutorial/Perwadjyt_Step_06_Content: Now that you've given your people basic food and water, you can enhance their lifestyle with other goods, such as pottery. Build a Clay Pit close to water, and a Potter nearby. Make sure these have access to labor as usual, and before long a cart will deliver clay to the Potter, who will create pottery for your city. Build a Storage Yard to store the final product as well as any excess clay the Potter does not need (3 Clay Pits can usually supply enough clay for 4 Potters). Workers from the Bazaar will collect the pottery from the Storage Yard and distribute it just as they do food. Industries like pottery also provide your city's inhabitants with much-needed jobs.
Tutorial/Perwadjyt_Step_07_Title: Start your industry with at least 1 clay pit and 2 potters
Tutorial/Perwadjyt_Step_08_Content: You always have to make sure that you have more population than job openings. However, not everyone in your city is able to work. You can get a quick glance at your working population & unemployment stats by hovering over the population counter on the top panel. More info is also available from your Overseers. Try to keep your unemployment below 10%, but make sure you always have enough workers. Pharaoh: A New Era simulates an aging population, where only 60% of the 20 to 49 years old are available for work. If you have trouble with this system, you can use the options to switch to a fixed worker ratio for your population, regardless of their age. In order to teach you to play with this mechanic, the option won’t affect this tutorial.
Tutorial/Perwadjyt_Step_09_Title: Store some Pottery in a Storage Yard
Tutorial/Perwadjyt_Step_10_Content: Great job! You've gotten some industry up and running, and now you can think about making a few improvements to your city. Beautification can be used to make some neighborhoods more desirable. By making the area surrounding them more attractive, Gardens, Statues and Plazas can help houses to evolve. Several Garden plots can be placed next to each other to form larger parks but their appearance will be random. Place Plazas on paved roads to enhance their appearance and improve the desirability of nearby land. You can rotate Statues, like most buildings, using the “R” key. If you’d rather choose which Garden you want to place, akin to Statues, you can switch between the two systems in the options.
Tutorial/Perwadjyt_Step_11_Title: Reach 600 population and 10 modest homesteads to win this mission
Tutorial/Perwadjyt_Step_Coverage_Content: The entertainment required to evolve houses gets higher and higher. In addition of the score provided by the visit of a juggler and - later - other entertainers, houses also get bonus points depending on your general coverage. You can check the entertainment coverage in your Overseer of Diversions. A booth providing a perfect coverage for 600 people, you might find yourself in situations where a juggler from a single booth passes by houses accommodating way more people than that. Placing other booths will help improve the coverage and provide more bonus points to all houses in your city. Sometimes it’s just what they need to evolve! Coverage from entertainment, education, religion and health all count toward your Culture Score. In later missions, when a high culture score is required to win, it's important to check their respective Overseers to see what your city is lacking.
Tutorial/Perwadjyt_Step_Next_Title: Place some Plazas over paved roads to improve desirability!
Tutorial/Nekhen_Step_01_Content: The patron god of this region is Ra, but Osiris and Bast are also worshiped here as local deities. Make sure this city has more Temples and Shrines dedicated to Ra, but don't neglect the local deities either! To accommodate your most valued citizens, make sure they have access to temples dedicated to different gods.
Tutorial/Nekhen_Step_03_Content: Sophisticated Egyptians like to listen to music in their leisure time, as well as take in the occasional juggling performance. While only Jugglers can perform at the small Booth, both Jugglers and Musicians can perform together at a Bandstand. Build a Bandstand at an intersection, and a Conservatory nearby to train Musicians. Access to multiple types of entertainment greatly enhances the quality of life in any city.
Tutorial/Nekhen_Step_05_Content: Your fellow Egyptians have perfected the art of brewing beer, which has become a very popular libation throughout Egypt! With a supply of barley received from local farms, brewers will make beer and deliver it to Storage Yards for future distribution by Bazaar workers, as with food and pottery.
Tutorial/Nekhen_Step_07_Content: A large city needs to bring in additional revenue, beyond its initial funding. One way to accomplish this is through taxation. In order to levy taxes, your city will need a Palace and Tax Collectors. Make sure to build enough Tax Collectors to cover the whole city, especially its more well-to-do neighborhoods. Remember, the better the quality of life enjoyed in a given home, the more taxes its occupants will pay. A Courthouse sends a magistrate to patrol the streets, who helps to reduce the risk of crime by hearing grievances and making sure that cooler heads prevail.
Tutorial/Nekhen_Step_09_Content: If you build a Mansion for yourself, you can draw a personal salary from the city's treasury. Personal funds are retained by your family, to be used whenever the situation demands, even in subsequent missions during the same Period. Beware, though, as awarding yourself a higher salary than is due your position can have detrimental effects on your standing in the kingdom.
Tutorial/Nekhen_Step_10_Title: Reach 1000 Population and 10 Modest Apartments to win this mission
Tutorial/Nekhen_Step_11_Content: Ferries can help your city run more smoothly. Carefully placed water crossings - ferries or bridges - let the inhabitants of your city reach otherwise inaccessible parts of the landscape to find prey or other valuable resources. In some cases, they can improve the timeliness of certain delivery people by shortening their journeys.
Tutorial/Nekhen_Step_12_Title: Reach 1000 Population and 10 Modest Apartments to win this mission
Tutorial/Nekhen_Step_BuildingPicker_Cont:
Sometimes you just want to place a building that you can already see on the screen. Instead of going through the construction menu, you can simply copy and paste it with the Building Picker.
Use ctrl + click on the building and voilà! You can now place it wherever you want!
Tutorial/Men-Nefer_Step_01_Content: Begin by planning for areas of housing and industry. By now you know what the people want, in addition to the basics of food and water. You must provide some houses with pottery, beer, entertainment and access to religious services before you can think about higher education and trade. From this tutorial and onward, now that you've learned how to play with recruiters, you can switch to the global worker pool in the options. This allows every building connected to a road to have automatic access to workers. While this is a big change from the original Pharaoh, giving you the choice makes the game more accessible and more fun for everyone!
Tutorial/Men-Nefer_Step_03_Content: Now that you've built up this city somewhat, it's time to provide education for some citizens. Scribal Schools cannot educate the people without papyrus on which to write. Reed Gatherers supply Papyrus Makers with the necessary raw materials, and papyrus is then distributed directly to the city's educational facilities.
Tutorial/Men-Nefer_Step_05_Content: Now that you have managed to educate some of your people, you might want to generate additional revenue by selling any surplus papyrus you have to neighboring cities. You'll also need to import bricks from Perwadjyt in order to build the sacred mastaba tomb. Click on the World Map icon on the left panel to see what other cities there are in the known world, and to begin setting up trade.
Tutorial/Men-Nefer_Step_07_Content:
The World Map shows the location of your own city, as well as other cities in the world. Here you can pay to open up trade routes with any cities willing to trade. 
To set up a trade route, click on the city you wish to do business with and select the "Open a trade route" option.
Tutorial/Men-Nefer_Step_09_Content: Once you set up a trade route, you'll still need to instruct the Overseer of Commerce as to which resources and commodities you wish to import or export. You can never import and export the same item at the same time. While you will need to import bricks, these can be quite costly, so you can offset this by selling any surplus papyrus you have!
Tutorial/Men-Nefer_Step_10_Title: Import at least 800 bricks from Perwadjyt before beginning work on the sacred mastaba tomb
Tutorial/Men-Nefer_Step_11_Content: Construction Guilds supply the skilled labor needed to erect monuments. The mastaba is made entirely of bricks and only requires Bricklayers' Guilds to build it. You can employ as many Bricklayers' Guilds as your economy can support, but make sure you also have enough bricks being delivered to the construction site to keep them busy. Once the Bricklayers' Guild has adequate labor, it will dispatch bricklayers to the construction site, where they will wait for a delivery of bricks from unskilled peasant laborers.
Tutorial/Men-Nefer_Step_12_Content: Once there are some bricklayers awaiting supplies at the monument site, gangs of peasant laborers will begin to haul loads of bricks to them. Because these same laborers also must tend the fields on the flood plain, you may find that work on the monument slows down somewhat when the flood has receded and the peasants return to their fields. You can construct additional Work Camps, so that any surplus laborers not needed to tend the fields may work on the monument year-round.
Tutorial/Men-Nefer_Step_13_Title: Place a small mastaba on the map
Tutorial/Men-Nefer_Step_14_Content:
You’ve reached the end of the tutorial - it's now up to you to finish Men-Nefer’s Mastaba! Make sure you balance your imports and exports and that your citizens have access to all the resources they need. 
In subsequent missions - until you reach Saqqara - you’ll get information on any new buildings, but there won't be anyone to hold your hand. 
If you forget something or need more information on a subject, you can access the in-game guide on the left panel. You can also access it from any open window, for example, if you click on a building, you’ll find a shortcut to access the guide and get additional info on it. 
If you’re looking for information on Ancient Egypt, there is also an in-game encyclopedia available. 
Enjoy your time in Ancient Egypt!
Tutorial/Men-Nefer_Step_CitySentiment_Co: As a ruler, it’s important for you to know how the people feel about you. It also important to be able to do something about it. If the people are angry, less people might come to your city. Immigration can even stop altogether, and at some point people will leave your city. City Sentiment can be checked with your Chief Overseer and is updated each month. The four main parameters of city sentiment are: Wages, Taxes, Unemployment and Slums. High Taxes, Wages lower than the rest of Egypt, unemployment over 10% and too many huts while you city hosts manors will all have a negative impact on City Sentiment. Of courses high taxes can be offset by high wages, and if taxes are low enough, unemployment might never be a problem but be sure to balance everything properly or people will leave you!
Tutorial/Timna_Step_01_Content:
To conscript troops, build a Fort and a Recruiter. The Recruiter will send new conscripts, one by one, to the fort until it is fully occupied. There are three types of Fort; infantry, archer and charioteer, and each Fort holds sixteen soldiers, referred to as one 'company'. If soldiers die in combat, the Recruiter will see to it that replacements are conscripted.
Archers supply their own bows and arrows, but infantry troops must be outfitted with copper-tipped spears. A Weaponsmith will forge these when supplied with freshly mined copper. Charioteers will need chariots, crafted from wood and copper. These are then delivered to the Recruiter, so that any new soldiers may be suitably equipped.
Tutorial/BedhetAbejdu_Step_01_Content:
The Shipwright builds warships and fishing boats. Each boat must be supported by its own Wharf. Whenever there is a Wharf in need of a vessel, the Shipwright will begin constructing one for it. Without a waiting Wharf, the Shipwright will not build any ships. Although a single Shipwright can supply all the vessels your city needs, multiple Shipwrights will allow you to progress much more quickly. The Shipwright doesn't need any materials to create fishing boats, but he will need a supply of wood and even weapons to construct military vessels, such as warships and transport ships. 
Docks won't require any ships - every maritime route you open with a city will allow the safe passage of their own merchant ships. Make sure you have storage yards close to your docks to allow trade to proceed as smoothly as possible.
Tutorial/AbuSelima_Step_01_Content:
As devotion to their patron gods continues to grow, the Egyptian people demand bigger and bigger places of worship. Most cities will want to erect a Temple Complex to their chosen god, so that they may fully partake of his or her benevolence. Once built, the Temple Complex may be expanded through the addition of an Oracle and an Altar, each dedicated to other, lesser gods. These gods, too, will impart certain benefits to the city.
With a supply of gemstones, Jewelers in your city can fashion jewelry. Jewelry is one type of valuable luxury good, which the higher social classes in the city demand. 
In addition to locally made Jewelry, the Egyptian people prize certain other luxury goods, which are available only through importation. A city needs access to more than one type of luxury good in order to become truly civilized.
Tutorial/Saqqara_Step_01_Content:
Some land is fertile enough for farming, even if it's not situated on the flood plain. You can identify such meadow areas by their colorful plant growth. Some farms planted on meadows can produce more than one harvest per year, though the yield is usually somewhat less than that of a floodplain farm. 
Employ irrigation to increase the fertility of any farmland. Irrigation ditches on the flood plain can be connected directly to the Nile, but you'll need a Water Lift to elevate the water onto dry land. Water Lifts can be built on the edge of the floodplain or on the coast, where you can raise water directly from the river up to dry land. Connect an irrigation ditch to the back of the Water Lift to supply irrigation water to inland farms.
Tutorial/Saqqara_Step_02_Content: More often than not, building a monument is not enough. Pharaohs tend to require that important resources are brought with them in the afterlife. In Saqqara, like in many other subsequent missions, you’ll have to deliver Burial Provisions in order to win. Simply go to your Overseer of Monuments and click on the required resources once you have enough of them in storage to deliver them. Sometimes these resources will only be available through trade, so make sure you have a strong enough economy to buy them all!
Tutorial/Timna_Step_02_Content:
To conscript troops, build a Fort and a Recruiter. The Recruiter will send new conscripts, one by one, to the fort until it is fully occupied. There are three types of Fort; infantry, archer and charioteer, and each Fort holds sixteen soldiers, referred to as one 'company'. 
If soldiers die in combat, the Recruiter will see to it that replacements are conscripted. Archers supply their own bows and arrows, but infantry troops must be outfitted with copper-tipped spears. A Weaponsmith will forge these when supplied with freshly mined copper.
Tutorial/Timna_Step_03_Content:
When attacked by enemies, every structure in your city is at risk of getting destroyed. To protect them, you can use walls, towers and gatehouses. Each defense building protects civilian structures in their area. You can check this with the Defense Overlay.
Fully circling a zone with defense structures will provide defense to every building inside it. You can complete fortifications with rocks or even water. Use gatehouses to provide access to the kingdom road though, your citizens will need to be able to move freely!
Tutorial/Timna_Step_04_Content:
Battles in Pharaoh: A New Era are automatically calculated. Each unit you have a value, and each manned tower will add points to the total value of your army. 
Having a stronger army than your opponent can save almost every building, despite the battle happening in your city. However, when opposing forces have approximately the same value, there will be more collateral damage.
Buildings protected by defense zones will not suffer collapse or burning.
But beware, while having a weaker army can still lead to victory, it might cause your fortification to weaken, opening well protected parts of your city to the fury of battle.
Walkers/#immigrant_e01: I'm new here. I wonder what the city will offer to a person like me.
Walkers/#immigrant_e02: I heard there is a job here for anyone who wants one.
Walkers/#immigrant_e03: People say that this city has plenty of food to go around.
Walkers/#emigrant_e01: I can't find a job here. I will look elsewhere.
Walkers/#emigrant_e02: There's not enough food for me to eat. I'm moving out of this desert!
Walkers/#emigrant_e03: Taxes are too high here. I'm surprised I wasn't taxed for leaving.
Walkers/#emigrant_e04: I can't live on what they pay me here.
Walkers/#emigrant_e05: The houses here are stuffed full of people. I can't stay here without a place to live.
Walkers/#vagrant_e01: I've been kicked out of my home, and through no fault of my own.
Walkers/#vagrant_e02: I can't find a place to live!
Walkers/#thief_e01: Maybe stealing from his treasury will get that false beard's attention!
Walkers/#thief_e02: I take what I want! Don't try to stop me!
Walkers/#thief_e03: Thievery is a lot more profitable than other jobs in this city!
Walkers/#thief_e04: Take, take, take. That's all I ever do.
Walkers/#disease_e01: Ohhh, my stomach! Oh, my head!
Walkers/#scribe_g01: Plague could break out at any time! I hope it stays in the poor parts of town!
Walkers/#scribe_g02: That a person of my quality could know hunger is scandalous!
Walkers/#scribe_g03: I don't think this city could handle an attack, and I have so very much to lose.
Walkers/#scribe_g04: How can so few workers properly cater to my needs?
Walkers/#scribe_g05: I'm treated far better than the gods! I hope they don't strike at us.
Walkers/#scribe_g06: I'm ashamed to live here. I hope our enemies don't take advantage of our reputation!
Walkers/#scribe_g07: Look at all these idlers! Why don't they get jobs?
Walkers/#scribe_g08: How can I lead a posh lifestyle if I'm not properly entertained?
Walkers/#scribe_g09: This city passes muster, I suppose.
Walkers/#scribe_e01: These festivals would be so much better if they were by invitation only.
Walkers/#hunt_ant_e01: Antelopes are no match for us!
Walkers/#hunt_ant_e02: There will be steaks for everyone tonight.
Walkers/#hunt_ostrich_e01: Ostriches are nearly invisible when they put their heads in the sand.
Walkers/#hunt_ostrich_e02: Now, those are some BIG drumsticks!
Walkers/#hunt_bird_e01: Birds are wily. They'll fly away if you don't approach them just right.
Walkers/#hunt_bird_e02: Look at those beautiful birds, ready for roasting!
Walkers/#fishing_e01: Another perfect day for fishing. I hope the catch is as plentiful as usual.
Walkers/#fishing_e02: Our hold is overflowing, but you should have seen the one that got away!
Walkers/#fishing_e03: Move faster! We can't get back to work until you unload us.
Walkers/#worker_g01: So many people are sick. I hope things don't get worse.
Walkers/#worker_g02: I'm famished. It's hard to work on an empty stomach.
Walkers/#worker_g03: I hope our enemies don't know how easy it would be to invade us.
Walkers/#worker_g04: There are job openings everywhere! Maybe I can get a job as a fire marshal!
Walkers/#worker_g05: I hope the gods don't unleash their wrath.
Walkers/#worker_g06: I hear that our city doesn't have a good reputation. We could come under attack!
Walkers/#worker_g07: I'll hold on to this job as tightly as I can. I know many people who are out of work.
Walkers/#worker_g08: All I ever do is work. There's nothing else to do in this city.
Walkers/#worker_g09: I like it here, but there is always room for improvement.
Walkers/#worker_g10: I hope I live here forever!
Walkers/#worker_e03: With the fields flooded, I now work for glory everlasting.
Walkers/#Labor_g01: I see sick people everywhere. A plague could break out!
Walkers/#Labor_g02: I'm starving. I'd rather be looking for food than for workers.
Walkers/#Labor_g03: City defenses are so weak, I could soon be filling jobs with foreigners instead of Egyptians.
Walkers/#Labor_g04: Without workers available, my job is impossible.
Walkers/#Labor_g05: I hope the gods don't unleash their fury. We need to pay more attention to them.
Walkers/#Labor_g06: Enemies could attack at any time. Our reputation is low, and no one respects us.
Walkers/#Labor_g07: With so many able people out of work, my job ought to be easy.
Walkers/#Labor_g08: It's boring here. I wish I could hire more entertainers.
Walkers/#Labor_g09: I don't mind living here. Things could certainly be worse.
Walkers/#Labor_e01: I'm the most popular person in the city. A lot of people need jobs.
Walkers/#Labor_e02: My list of job openings is huge, and I can't find any workers to fill the posts.
Walkers/#woodcutter_e01: I am off for a hard day's logging.
Walkers/#woodcutter_e02: This timber will be put to good use, I am sure.
Walkers/#REED_E01: To the marsh I march for the reeds we need.
Walkers/#REED_E02: These reeds will make some fine papyrus.
Walkers/#carpenter_e01: My services are needed at the monument!
Walkers/#carpenter_e02: This monument would be very short without my ramps and scaffolds.
Walkers/#brick_e01: It's bricklaying time at the monument!
Walkers/#brick_e02: With my bricks, this monument will be strong.
Walkers/#stone_e01: I'm going to the monument to shape the stones.
Walkers/#stone_e02: My stonework will endure through the ages.
Walkers/#mkt_buyer_g01: So many people have taken ill. I hope they recover soon, or else a plague might break out.
Walkers/#mkt_buyer_g02: I'm starving. Most of my customers demand food, and I can barely feed myself.
Walkers/#mkt_buyer_g03: Our defenses are flimsy. We could easily be invaded.
Walkers/#mkt_buyer_g04: I better be extra nice to my helpers. With this many job openings in the city, I could easily lose them.
Walkers/#mkt_buyer_g05: If we don't soon pay the gods more respect, they are going to dole out a miserable punishment.
Walkers/#mkt_buyer_g06: I wouldn't dream of letting my reputation slip as far as this city's has. We could soon pay the price.
Walkers/#mkt_buyer_g07: I'm lucky to have a job. I know a lot of people who are out of work.
Walkers/#mkt_buyer_g08: Nothing whatsoever happens here. I wish there were more shows to see.
Walkers/#mkt_buyer_g09: I won't complain about this city... but I could.
Walkers/#mkt_buyer_e01: The bazaar needs some items, and I'm going to get them.
Walkers/#mkt_buyer_e02: These goods will make welcome additions to the bazaar.
Walkers/#mkt_seller_e01: My supplies sold like hot cakes! I'm going back to the Bazaar for more.
Walkers/#mkt_seller_e02: I do my best to give the people what they want.
Walkers/#marketboy_e01: These baskets are too heavy for a little kid like me!
Walkers/#marketboy_e02: That bossy lady makes me carry goods all day!
Walkers/#marketboy_e03: Maybe I just carry baskets now, but one day I'll run the Bazaar.
Walkers/#cartpusher_e01: I'm not taking these supplies any further until someone's available to unload them.
Walkers/#cartpusher_e02: No one can accept these goods! That's okay, I can use the rest.
Walkers/#cartpusher_e03: I have to go clear across the city with these goods. It'll take all day!
Walkers/#dockpusher_e01: We're doing more than our share of work. We need more help.
Walkers/#dockpusher_e02: I'll wait here until some space for this stuff opens up.
Walkers/#dockpusher_e03: Am I there yet? I can't haul these goods much further.
Walkers/#barge_e01: I wonder if this city has any sights I could see while they unload my ship.
Walkers/#barge_e02: We're waiting for some cargo to be delivered to our ship.
Walkers/#barge_e03: I don't know why we came. This city never trades, and the shore leave is boring.
Walkers/#barge_e04: I love the art of the deal! I can't wait to trade my supplies.
Walkers/#caravan_e01: Our long and dangerous trek here was for nothing! This city won't trade.
Walkers/#caravan_e02: Buy low, sell high. That's my motto!
Walkers/#caravan_e03: It's the trader's life for me!
Walkers/#caravan_e04: I'll be a hero when I bring these goods back to my homeland.
Walkers/#caravan_e05: You talk a fine bargain, my friend. I'll barely make back my costs.
Walkers/#juggler_g01: I've never seen so many sick people. I hope a plague doesn't break out.
Walkers/#juggler_g02: It's hard to catch these clubs when you're doubled over with hunger pangs.
Walkers/#juggler_g03: Maybe I can throw these clubs at the enemy should they attack. Little else is defending this city.
Walkers/#juggler_g04: I see job vacancies everywhere! I wonder if I could juggle more than one job.
Walkers/#juggler_g05: I'm expecting the worst. The gods must think we've forgotten them.
Walkers/#juggler_g06: This city has a worse reputation than I do. I hope no one attacks us.
Walkers/#juggler_g07: I wish there were more jobs in this city. None of the people I entertain can pay me.
Walkers/#juggler_g08: I can only juggle so much. I wish there were other entertainers in the city.
Walkers/#juggler_g10: There's no place I'd rather juggle.
Walkers/#juggler_e01: I love working these festival crowds. Everyone's so happy!
Walkers/#musician_g01: If health doesn't improve in this city, I'll be stuck playing funeral dirges.
Walkers/#musician_g02: I'd sing for my supper, but this city doesn't have enough food.
Walkers/#musician_g03: Maybe I could beat invaders over the head with my sistrum. The city is not defended well.
Walkers/#musician_g04: All my performances are solos. This city doesn't have enough workers.
Walkers/#musician_g05: I hope my music soothes the gods. Their anger could soon rain down on us.
Walkers/#musician_g06: Our terrible reputation could provoke an attack!
Walkers/#musician_g07: For the last time, I am not hiring any more roadies! So many people are looking for work.
Walkers/#musician_g08: Even an entertainer likes to be entertained! There's not enough to do here.
Walkers/#musician_g09: This city could be a lot worse, I suppose.
Walkers/#musician_g10: I hope we continue to make beautiful music in this city for a long time.
Walkers/#musician_e01: These festivals are great! Everyone sings along.
Walkers/#dancer_g01: Many people have taken ill in the city. I hope I don't catch anything!
Walkers/#dancer_g02: I can't prance and leap very well without enough food!
Walkers/#dancer_g03: Invaders would have little trouble taking over our city. Nothing defends it.
Walkers/#dancer_g04: Another dance partner lost to the worker shortage! I hate dancing alone.
Walkers/#dancer_g05: We should do more to appease the gods - and quickly!
Walkers/#dancer_g06: This city's reputation is worse than a juggler's! I hope we aren't attacked.
Walkers/#dancer_g07: If I weren't so light on my feet, I would trip over all these jobless people!
Walkers/#dancer_g09: This city is just about as good as any other city, I guess.
Walkers/#dancer_e01: These festival crowds are so enthusiastic, they make me want to leap higher.
Walkers/#senet_g01: People's health is in jeopardy. The risk of plague is great.
Walkers/#senet_g02: I'm as hungry as a hippo, but there's little food to be found.
Walkers/#senet_g03: I ought to learn the crafts of war. With defenses so weak, we're at risk.
Walkers/#senet_g04: The worker shortage could cause real trouble in the city.
Walkers/#senet_g05: To tell the truth, I would not dare to treat the gods so badly.
Walkers/#senet_g06: This city's reputation is checkered at best. We could be attacked.
Walkers/#senet_g07: For most, finding work in this city is a trivial pursuit that ends in failure.
Walkers/#senet_g08: This city should clue in to the lack of entertainment!
Walkers/#senet_g09: I'm not sorry to live here.
Walkers/#senet_g10: This city has a monopoly on my heart. I love it here!
Walkers/#senet_e01: Get your beer here! Warm, flat, refreshing beer! Low in sediment!
Walkers/#priest_osiris_g01: The city is flooded with sick people. I hope a plague doesn't break out.
Walkers/#priest_osiris_g02: No priest of Osiris should have to suffer from hunger!
Walkers/#priest_osiris_g03: Our city is almost defenseless. I hope no one attacks.
Walkers/#priest_osiris_g04: Without workers, we may not be able to pay Osiris the respect he deserves.
Walkers/#priest_osiris_g05: Osiris is not the only god made angry by neglect.
Walkers/#priest_osiris_g06: Our city is the laughingstock of Egypt. We are ripe for attack.
Walkers/#priest_osiris_g07: Unemployment is a serious problem in this city. I hope more jobs open up soon.
Walkers/#priest_osiris_g08: Even a priest needs more than prayers to be entertained.
Walkers/#priest_osiris_g10: Osiris is proud to be worshiped in such a fine city.
Walkers/#priest_osiris_e02: Osiris could punish the city for its neglect with a low flood.
Walkers/#priest_ra_g01: The people coming to the Temple don't look healthy. I hope the illness doesn't escalate.
Walkers/#priest_ra_g02: I don't have enough food to feed Ra or myself!
Walkers/#priest_ra_g03: I wish it were up to Ra to defend our city. I don't think this city does a good job of it.
Walkers/#priest_ra_g04: I hope this city finds more workers soon. Services could soon suffer.
Walkers/#priest_ra_g05: This city would do well to pay more respect to the gods.
Walkers/#priest_ra_g06: Reputation is important. Without it, the city is prone to hostile takeover.
Walkers/#priest_ra_g07: I've never heard more people ask Ra whether they'll finally land a job.
Walkers/#priest_ra_g08: I need more entertainment. Pleasing Ra all day isn't easy, and I need to relax.
Walkers/#priest_ra_g09: I have no major complaints about this city.
Walkers/#priest_ra_g10: The only place better than this city is the Field of Reeds.
Walkers/#priest_ra_e01: Ra loves to see his people during the festival.
Walkers/#priest_ra_e02: Our city is an embarrassment to the rest of the Kingdom.
Walkers/#priest_ptah_g01: Poor health could result in plague if nothing is done about conditions in the city.
Walkers/#priest_ptah_g02: The rumbling of my empty stomach distracts me from my duties to Ptah.
Walkers/#priest_ptah_g03: Our holey defenses will be useless if anyone chooses to attack us.
Walkers/#priest_ptah_g04: It saddens Ptah to see industries idle because of the worker shortage.
Walkers/#priest_ptah_g05: The gods may inflict just retribution if the city continues to ignore them.
Walkers/#priest_ptah_g06: Our ill repute could encourage invaders.
Walkers/#priest_ptah_g07: Ptah wishes that all the unemployed in the city could find productive work.
Walkers/#priest_ptah_g08: I like to have a good time, just like anyone else. I wish there were more entertainers in this city.
Walkers/#priest_ptah_g09: This city has its problems, but it's a good place to live.
Walkers/#priest_ptah_g10: This is the best crafted city in all of Egypt!
Walkers/#priest_ptah_e01: Ptah knows that holidays make workers happier.
Walkers/#priest_ptah_e02: Ptah's guiding hand can do only so much. The industries in this city need more workers!
Walkers/#priest_seth_g01: A plague may wreak havoc on the city if health does not improve.
Walkers/#priest_seth_g02: All day, I battle my hunger. I need more food.
Walkers/#priest_seth_g03: We'll have to rely on Seth to protect us in battle. The city isn't prepared to defend itself.
Walkers/#priest_seth_g04: Services are suffering because no workers can be found!
Walkers/#priest_seth_g05: This city should stop provoking the gods' anger with its inaction.
Walkers/#priest_seth_g06: We may soon find out how little others think of our city when they sweep in and destroy it.
Walkers/#priest_seth_g07: The legions of the unemployed clog the streets.
Walkers/#priest_seth_g08: It's hard to believe how dull it is here!
Walkers/#priest_seth_g09: This city is suitable enough for me.
Walkers/#priest_seth_g10: This city is unrivaled in all Egypt!
Walkers/#priest_seth_e01: Even Seth's warriors need the occasional festival.
Walkers/#priest_seth_e02: Glory is on the horizon! Enemies are fast approaching the city.
Walkers/#priest_bast_g01: Bast cries to see so many sickly people. I hope the plague doesn't strike.
Walkers/#priest_bast_g02: It's hard to get enough food in this city. Hunger strikes everyone.
Walkers/#priest_bast_g03: Our city's woeful defenses invite our foes to attack us.
Walkers/#priest_bast_g04: Our city cannot possibly run well with so many job openings.
Walkers/#priest_bast_g05: The gods are turning their backs on this city. We should pay them more respect.
Walkers/#priest_bast_g06: The city's reputation is terrible. An invasion could come at any time.
Walkers/#priest_bast_g07: Not even Bast can lighten the hearts of so many jobless people.
Walkers/#priest_bast_g08: Bast is horrified by the lack of entertainment in this city.
Walkers/#priest_bast_g09: This city isn't a bad place to live.
Walkers/#priest_bast_e02: People in the city are deeply unhappy. They could soon turn to crime.
Walkers/#priest_bast_e03: What's a priestess to do? There is so little diversion here.
Walkers/#priest_bast_e04: Bast grants me power to heal the sick before they spread their disease.
Walkers/#teacher_g01: The city may soon learn that bad health can lead to a horrible plague.
Walkers/#teacher_g02: My mind is fed with learning, but my body hungers for food.
Walkers/#teacher_g03: Invaders would have no trouble penetrating our scanty defenses!
Walkers/#teacher_g04: The scarcity of workers reverberates throughout the city, limiting its services.
Walkers/#teacher_g05: The city's sacrilegious ways could cause the gods to smite us!
Walkers/#teacher_g06: Ah, reputation, reputation. Our scandalous reputation invites attack.
Walkers/#teacher_g07: Even education won't cure this city's jobless problem.
Walkers/#teacher_g08: Boring, dull, tedious, monotonous, ho-hum. This city is all five.
Walkers/#teacher_e01: One can learn much about human nature at a festival.
Walkers/#library_g01: People are sick. My medical papyri tell me that the illness could soon escalate to plague!
Walkers/#library_g02: I'm famished. It's hard to lift my scrolls on an empty stomach.
Walkers/#library_g03: Even the simplest enemy could manage to get through our defenses!
Walkers/#library_g04: Unless more workers arrive soon, the city will surely suffer.
Walkers/#library_g05: The literature is replete with stories of angry gods and their vengeance.
Walkers/#library_g06: History shows that a city like ours will pay serious consequences for its poor reputation.
Walkers/#library_g07: There are a lot of unemployed in the city. At least they have plenty of time to read.
Walkers/#library_g08: Sometimes my eyes like to rest on something other than hieroglyphs. I want to see a show!
Walkers/#library_g09: This city is comparable to others I've read about.
Walkers/#library_g10: This city is the best that history has ever known!
Walkers/#water_g01: I'm afraid to go into some neighborhoods. People are sick, and I don't want to catch anything.
Walkers/#water_g02: I'm weak from hunger. I'm nearly collapsing under the weight of all this water.
Walkers/#water_g03: It seems that it will be up to the citizens to defend this city if it comes under attack.
Walkers/#water_g04: Jobs, jobs everywhere, and not a worker to fill them.
Walkers/#water_g05: If I were a god, I wouldn't be pleased with this city's lack of attention to me.
Walkers/#water_g06: I hear that other cities are laughing at us and are planning to invade.
Walkers/#water_g07: I see plenty of people out of work as I make my deliveries.
Walkers/#water_g08: Carrying water is not entertainment. I wish we had some real diversions here.
Walkers/#water_g09: I like living here, but if I were running the town I'd do some things differently.
Walkers/#water_g10: There is no better place upon this earth.
Walkers/#dentist_g01: People are so concerned about catching the plague that they're neglecting their teeth.
Walkers/#dentist_g02: I've had so little to eat lately...what a sad waste of perfect teeth.
Walkers/#dentist_g03: The city's defenses are full of gaps. Our enemies could have their way with us.
Walkers/#dentist_g04: This city's workforce is like an old man's mouth. So many holes to be filled!
Walkers/#dentist_g05: I'm worried about this city's molars - I mean morals! We need to pay the gods more respect.
Walkers/#dentist_g06: Our reputation is rotten. We could be attacked.
Walkers/#dentist_g07: I've never seen so many people out of work before!
Walkers/#dentist_g08: I'm bored! I guess I'll brush my teeth again.
Walkers/#dentist_g09: This city is okay. Only a few cavities!
Walkers/#dentist_g10: This city has the brightest smile in all of Egypt.
Walkers/#doctor_g01: With city health so dismal, I'm a busy man. Still, plague threatens.
Walkers/#doctor_g02: Being hungry all the time isn't good for me.
Walkers/#doctor_g03: I'd advise this city to bolster its defenses so our enemies do not do us damage.
Walkers/#doctor_g04: I've seen many workers pushed to their limits. This city could use more employees.
Walkers/#doctor_g05: I don't think we're paying the gods enough respect. This is terribly risky behavior.
Walkers/#doctor_g06: Our base reputation invites others to attack.
Walkers/#doctor_g07: Sitting idly by waiting for jobs is bad for our people's health!
Walkers/#doctor_g08: I've had people come in for checkups just because they've got nothing better to do!
Walkers/#doctor_g09: This city is good enough, I guess.
Walkers/#doctor_g10: I cannot imagine a healthier place to live.
Walkers/#doctor_e01: Plague could strike us dead at any moment!
Walkers/#embalmer_g01: Judging by the number of sick people in this city, I could soon have my hands full!
Walkers/#embalmer_g02: I'm famished. Before long, I'll be skinnier than a mummy!
Walkers/#embalmer_g03: The city is not securely wrapped in defenses. An enemy could easily defeat us.
Walkers/#embalmer_g04: If I ever wanted to leave embalming behind, now is my chance. So many job openings!
Walkers/#embalmer_g05: The gods could soon unravel our city if we don't pay them more respect.
Walkers/#embalmer_g06: The city's bad reputation could be the death of us all. We could be attacked at any moment.
Walkers/#embalmer_g07: When I see so many people out of work, it makes me glad that I have a job.
Walkers/#embalmer_g08: This city is as dead as the bodies I work with all day. I wish the city were alive with entertainment.
Walkers/#embalmer_g09: I might as will live here. It's about as good as anywhere else.
Walkers/#embalmer_g10: I feel truly sorry for my clients. They aren't around to enjoy this incredible city!
Walkers/#embalmer_e01: Health seems to be worsening throughout the city.
Walkers/#apothecary_e02: Malaria doesn't seem to be a problem here.
Walkers/#apothecary_e03: An outbreak of malaria could strike if something isn't done.
Walkers/#fireman_g01: I hope a plague doesn't break out. Plagues can spread like wildfire.
Walkers/#fireman_g02: Even when fires are burning, all I can think about is how hungry I am.
Walkers/#fireman_g03: If our enemies invade, the whole city could go up in flames.
Walkers/#fireman_g04: I fear that some of these half-empty buildings could catch fire. I wish there were more workers.
Walkers/#fireman_g05: The gods' fiery wrath will come down on us if we don't pay more respect.
Walkers/#fireman_g06: I wouldn't dream of letting my reputation sink so low. Our city's bad reputation is inviting attack.
Walkers/#fireman_g07: I've had more people volunteer for the fire department. These people need jobs.
Walkers/#fireman_g08: Firefighting is hard work, and I'd love to cool off with a good show. There's not enough of that here.
Walkers/#fireman_e01: I can't talk now. I'm busy dousing this fire.
Walkers/#fireman_e02: This fire could burn the whole city down if I don't act fast!
Walkers/#engineer_g01: A lot of people are in much worse condition than the buildings. I hope things don't get worse.
Walkers/#engineer_g02: Starvation might not affect the strength of these buildings, but it sure affects mine!
Walkers/#engineer_g03: How are we to defend ourselves? The city's defenses are laughable.
Walkers/#engineer_g04: Why does it matter if these buildings collapse? There aren't any workers in them anyway.
Walkers/#engineer_g05: When the gods are angry, not even the best architect can fix the damage they cause.
Walkers/#engineer_g06: Our city's reputation is so low, I fear our enemies will attack.
Walkers/#engineer_g07: By my estimation, a lot of people are out of work.
Walkers/#engineer_g08: Ho hum. Even architects like a little fun every now and then.
Walkers/#engineer_g09: Life here could be a lot worse.
Walkers/#engineer_g10: This city has everything an architect's heart could desire!
Walkers/#engineer_e01: There are so many places in poor condition, I can barely keep up.
Walkers/#engineer_e02: I hope I'm credited for the great condition of this city.
Walkers/#police_g01: With so many people so weak and sickly, I fear for the future.
Walkers/#police_g02: I haven't eaten in so long, even I'm considering stealing food!
Walkers/#police_g03: If invaders do come, it looks like it will be up to me to defend the city.
Walkers/#police_g04: If I didn't enjoy the danger of police work, I'd quickly take one of the many available jobs.
Walkers/#police_g05: If I were running things, I'd pay more attention to the gods.
Walkers/#police_g06: I've heard our city is an easy mark for invaders. We have a bad reputation.
Walkers/#police_g07: I don't like to see this many jobless loiterers. I can't walk my beat without tripping over them!
Walkers/#police_g08: This city is dull. I can't find any good shows to see.
Walkers/#police_g09: This city isn't perfect, but then what city is?
Walkers/#police_g10: If only the Bazaar carried donuts, this city would be perfect.
Walkers/#police_e01: Everybody's friendly here. No one is reporting any crimes.
Walkers/#police_e02: A few crimes here, a few crimes there, but nothing out of the ordinary.
Walkers/#police_e03: Even I don't like to walk in this part of town!
Walkers/#police_e04: I'm really too busy to talk right now - ask me again later.
Walkers/#police_e05: I'll do my part to make sure this city is safe!
Walkers/#police_e06: Fighting invaders wasn't in my job description!
Walkers/#police_e07: These rascals aren't taking over the city on my watch!
Walkers/#police_e08: The enemy could soon win if I don't get some help!
Walkers/#taxman_g01: It seems an illness is taxing the people's health. I pray a plague doesn't strike.
Walkers/#taxman_g02: I wish people could pay their taxes in food. I'm so hungry!
Walkers/#taxman_g03: Our city doesn't seem capable of defending itself!
Walkers/#taxman_g04: No amount of tax money is going to make this city run smoothly. We need more workers!
Walkers/#taxman_g05: We owe the gods a great debt, and I don't want to be here when they come to collect!
Walkers/#taxman_g06: I've heard that invasion is imminent given our standing in Egypt.
Walkers/#taxman_g07: Many of these houses have unemployed workers! How can they be expected to pay tax?
Walkers/#taxman_g08: As much as I like collecting taxes, I'd still like to see some professional entertainment.
Walkers/#taxman_g10: I'd rather live here than anywhere else!
Walkers/#taxman_e01: This city could bring in so much more revenue if they'd just hire some more tax collectors.
Walkers/#taxman_e02: Seems like the nicer their houses, the more people grumble about paying their share.
Walkers/#taxman_e03: I hate collecting taxes from these run-down houses. It's hardly worth my time.
Walkers/#magistrate_g01: Health conditions in this city are criminal. Plague is the punishment that fits the crime.
Walkers/#magistrate_g02: I'm so hungry, a good meal will buy you any verdict you want.
Walkers/#magistrate_g03: What woeful defenses! Our enemies could walk right into the city and take over.
Walkers/#magistrate_g04: I've never seen so many job openings before!
Walkers/#magistrate_g05: The gods will find us guilty of neglect if we don't start paying more attention to them.
Walkers/#magistrate_g06: Our city is judged among the worst in the Kingdom. I dread the execution of our punishment.
Walkers/#magistrate_g07: Unemployed people have too much time on their hands, and that's dangerous.
Walkers/#magistrate_g08: This city is guilty of poor entertainment options!
Walkers/#magistrate_g09: This city is balanced: nothing too good, but nothing too bad.
Walkers/#magistrate_g10: I judge this city to be the best.
Walkers/#magistrate_e02: I hope I will earn a funeral procession when the time comes.
Walkers/#magistrate_e03: All is quiet in the court. There is no crime here.
Walkers/#magistrate_e04: I've only been trying petty cases. Nothing too serious!
Walkers/#magistrate_e05: I can barely manage my caseload, yet the streets are still unsafe.
Walkers/#artisan_e01: My painting and plastering skills are needed at the monument!
Walkers/#artisan_e02: I capture the stories of Egypt on the walls of the royal tombs.
Walkers/#robber_e01: Gold should be for the living, not the dead!
Walkers/#robber_e02: Just think of the fortune I'll have when I sell off all those treasures!
Walkers/#warship_e01: We'll fight to the death to defend our fair city!
Walkers/#warship_e02: The enemy is too much for us! If we escape them, we'll be ready to fight another day.
Walkers/#warship_e04: We're as dangerous as a crocodile, ready to attack our invaders when they arrive.
Walkers/#warship_e05: If and when our foes come, we'll be ready for them.
Walkers/#transport_e01: Row harder! We must protect our ship at all costs!
Walkers/#transport_e02: The enemy is here! All hands prepare for maneuvers.
Walkers/#transport_e03: Bring on the attack! We're prepared.
Walkers/#transport_e04: We're ready to serve if the need arises.
Walkers/#guard_e01: No enemies have been sighted, but we're ready nonetheless.
Walkers/#guard_e02: We're coiled like an asp, eager to strike at the approaching enemy.
Walkers/#guard_e03: You call that an army?! We'll have no trouble defeating that motley crew.
Walkers/#guard_e04: This enemy is a fierce one! I'm doing all that I can to defeat them.
Walkers/#zookeeper_e01: This danger of disease is so great that even the laughing hyenas are sad.
Walkers/#zookeeper_e02: How will we feed the animals when we can't feed ourselves?
Walkers/#zookeeper_e03: Our defenses are terribly weak. Perhaps I should train the hippo to fight?
Walkers/#zookeeper_e04: Even an elephant cannot recall when the worker shortage has been worse.
Walkers/#zookeeper_e05: When a god is angry, you don't want to stick your neck out like a giraffe!
Walkers/#zookeeper_e06: Pharaoh is so unhappy. I hope my zoo animals won't be needed for exotic gifts!
Walkers/#zookeeper_e07: Trying to land a job in this city is more difficult than trapping a wild lion.
Walkers/#zookeeper_e08: The entertainment situation in this city stinks worse than the monkey cages.
Walkers/#zookeeper_e09: Living here is better than sleeping in the lions' pen.
Walkers/#zookeeper_e10: I am happier than a mud-covered hippo to be living in this city.
Walkers/#birds_flavor: Only the best of hunters will catch these wild birds.
Walkers/#ostrich_flavor: Invisible to human eyes when they hide their heads in the sand.
Walkers/#antelop_flavor: Catch them before the lions do.
Walkers/#crocodile_flavor: You won't see any tears rolling down their thick armored skin.
Walkers/#hyena_flavor: Hyenas don't wander far from their den unless they have a good reason. Eating a lost citizen is often a good one.
Walkers/#hippopotamus_flavor: The biggest, baddest, meanest mammal out there.
Walkers/#asp_flavor: No one has been able to get close enough to confirm whether it's a viper or not.
Walkers/#lion_flavor: Just a big cat. Also happens to be the king of beasts.
Walkers/#scorpion_flavor: As they say, size isn't everything.
Walkers/#mule_flavor: They carried blocs of granite through the desert so your city could refuse to trade, and you don't hear them complain.
Walkers/#fish_flavor: Teach a man to fish and he'll empty the Nile faster than you can imagine.
Walkers/#frog_flavor: Their land swarmed with frogs, even in the chambers of their kings.
Walkers/#locust_flavor: He spoke, and the locusts came, young locusts without number.
Walkers/#mummy_flavor: Embalmed bodies make for the best nightmares.
Walkers/#bazaarboy_flavor: He'll follow that lady anywhere, carrying food and goods for the people.
Walkers/#Carrier_WaitingFor: Waiting for a place to deliver his goods from the {0}
Worldmap/#TradeRouteClosed: This trading route is not yet established
Worldmap/#OpenCommericalLandRoadContent: Pay to open this land trade route?
Worldmap/#OpenCommericalWaterRoadContent: Pay to open this water trade route?
